texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socios emprendedores una de ella es Arlen que vende gaseosas, refrescos naturales desde hace 4 años, inicio vendiendo el producto en su domicilio en menor escalas y con las utilidades fue aumentando sus productos hasta lograr lo que tiene actualmente. Arlen, lo invertirá el crédito en la compra de gaseosas al por mayor. Ana Luisa lo invertira en la vende de verduras y Juan lo invertira en la vende productos derivados del maíz como el pinol, pinolillo, atol de elote, pozol etc.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three enterprising individuals. One of these is Arlen, who has sold fizzy drinks and natural soft drinks for the past four years. 

Arlen began selling these products in her home in small quantities, and used her earnings to buy more products until the amount she has today. She will invest the loan in buying wholesale fizzy drinks.

Ana Luisa will invest in the sale of vegetables and Juan will invest in the sale of corn-based products such as the traditional cornmeal and cacao drinks pinol, pinollilo, atol de elote, pozol etc.

loans.use: to buy a variety of wholesale fizzy drinks

loans.name: Ignacia Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ella es Iganacia  De la cruz de 41 años de edad, madre de un hijo tiene 10 años de compra y vende cosechas de tamarindo, y acopio de granos básicos, inicio  vendiendo frutas frescas en un mercado de su localidad, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de cosechas de tamarindo, Guillermina tiene una pulpería en su domicilio y Griselda tiene una crianza de cerdos compra y vende los cerdos en pie.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three enterprising members. One of these is Ignacia. She is 41 years old and the mother of a 10-year-old boy. She makes a living buying and selling tamarind crops, and storing basic grains. Ignacia has begun selling her fresh fruits in a nearby market.

She will invest this loan to buy tamarind crops. 

Guillermina has a small general store in her house and Griselda raises and sells pigs.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal crops.

loans.name: La Familia Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras de éxito es el caso de Dolores que es una mujer casada, con un hijo mayor, tiene 37 años de edad hace 19 años que tiene una pulpería en su domicilio, de ser cliente de Adim tiene 6 años consecutivos, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de granos básicos como arroz, aceite, frijoles, azúcar, papel higiénico, medicamentos populares, detergentes, carne de res, carne de pollo, productos lácteos, etc. Rosa vende ropa usada y gaseosa y Lorenza vende papel periódico reciclado.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three successful and enterprising members, one of whom is Dolores. 

Dolores is married with one adult son. She is 37 years old and has owned a grocery store in her home for 19 years. She has been a client of Adim for six consecutive years. She will invest this loan in the purchase of basic grains such as rice, oil, beans, sugar, toilet paper, popular medicines, detergent, beef, chicken, and dairy products, among others.

Rosa sells used clothing and Lorenza sells recycled newspaper.

loans.use: to buy basic grains such as rice and beans, sugar, oil, beef, chicken, dairy products, popular medicines, detergent, toilet paper, etc.

loans.name: Mi Bendicion Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socios emprendedores una de ella es Jeyser tiene 30 años de edad, casada, un hijo menor que estudia  y se dedica a la venta de pollo, queso, crema chontaleña, zapatos usados, carne molida, mortadela etc. esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 2 años  ya que anteriormente trabajaba como dependienta en una tienda de ropa, el crédito lo invertirá en la  compra de calzado para hombre, nuevos y usado, crema chontaleña, carne molida etc. Juan vende ropa nueva y Valeria vende también ropa nueva.
texts.en:
The group is made up of three enterprising members.  One of them is Jeyser, 30.  She's married, has a minor child who's a student, and makes a living selling chicken, cheese, Chontaleña cream, ground beef, mortadella, used shoes, etc.  She has been doing this job for two years because previously she was working as a clerk in a clothing store.

She's going to invest the loan in buying new and used men's shoes, Chontaleña cream, ground beef, etc.

Juan sells new clothing and Valeria also sells new clothing.

loans.use: to buy food products and new and used men's shoes

loans.name: Union Y  Esfuerzo Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socias emprendedoras de éxito una de ella es Cándida que se dedica a la venta de nacatamal y pan desde hace dos años, inicia su negocio vendiendo nacatamales, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como carne de cerdo, hojas de chagüites, perecederos, arroz, vegetales, maíz, cal, etc. Brígida vende sopa los fines de semanas en su casa y Ana vende comida y cosméticos de la Avon variado.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three successful, enterprising members.  One of them is Cándida who sells nacatamales [Nicaraguan-style tamales] and bread; she’s been in business about two years and started out selling nacatamales.  She will use the loan to buy raw materials like pork, banana leaves, perishables, rice, vegetables, corn, lime powder, etc.

Brígida sells soup at home on the weekend and Ana sells food and assorted Avon cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Poder De Dios Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socios emprendedores, una de ella es Maria mujer de 28 años, casada y con un hijo. Tiene cinco años de vender frutas frescas, inicia su negocio vendiendo nacatamales, actualmente también vende cosechas como de aguacate, tamarindo, naranjas al por mayor, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de cosechas de tamarindo, aguacate, naranjas etc. Elsa vende comida y frutas frescas y Carlos tiene una pulpería en su domicilio.
texts.en:
This group has three enterprising members.  María, a 28-year-old woman, is one of them.  She’s married and has a son.  She’s been selling fresh fruit for five years.  She started her business selling nacatamales [Nicaraguan-style tamales] and currently also sells avocado, tamarind and orange harvests at wholesale.  She will use the loan to buy tamarind, avocado, orange harvests, etc. 

Elsa sells food and fresh fruit and Carlos has a home-based grocery store.

loans.use: to buy tamarind, avocado and orange harvests.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socios emprendedores de éxito una de ella es Yesica es una mujer casada, tiene un año de vender frutas y verduras en el mercado de Masaya, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de frutas como manzanas, uvas, papaya, sandias, naranjas y verduras como cebolla dulce, chiltoma, tomate, papa etc. Anielka vende productos de la Avon, zermat y Nelson vende zapatos.
texts.en:
This is a group consisting of three enterprising, successful members.  One of them is Yesica, a married woman.  She’s been selling fruit and vegetables in Masaya’s market for a year.  She will use the loan to buy fruit like apples, grapes, papaya, watermelon and oranges and vegetables like sweet onions, peppers, tomatoes, potatoes, etc. 

Anielka sells Avon and Zermat products and Nelson sells shoes.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Luz Del Esfuerzo Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias emprendedora de éxito una de ella es María tiene 58 años de edad, con cinco hijos mayores y tiene cuatro años de vender detergente, jabón de baño al por mayor, inicio su negocio anteriormente vendía plátanos . El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de detergentes por cajas al por mayor, Vilma vende tortilla y nacatamales y Martha vende jabón de baño, detergente, pasta de dientes, cloro etc.
texts.en: This group is made up of 3 successful entrepreneurs, one of which is María. María is 58 years old and has 5 older children. She has 4 years selling detergent and bathroom soap in bulk. She began her business after she sold plantains. She will invest this loan in the purchase of detergent in bulk by the case. Vilma sells tortillas and tamales and Martha sells bathroom soap, detergent, toothpaste, bleach, etc.

loans.use: to buy detergent wholesale by the case.

loans.name: Las Exitosas Group

texts.es: Está formado por tres microempresarias una de ella es Indira es una mujer soltera con 28 años de edad, desde hace seis meses que tiene un cyber en su domicilio anteriormente se dedicaba al comercio, ella misma atiende su negocio, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materiales de oficina como fastener, folder legal, folder de carta, lapiceros, resaltadores, regla etc.Jelua es estilista a domicilio y Anielka vende bisuterías.
texts.en:
It's made up of three micro-entrepreneurs, one of whom is Indira, a 28-year-old single woman.  She has had an internet cafe in her home for two years.  Previously she made a living as a merchant.  She tends to her business herself.

She's going to invest the loan in buying office supplies such as paper fasteners, legal and letter folders, pencils, highlighters, rulers, etc.

Jelua's a stylist at home and Anielka sells costume jewelry.

loans.use: to buy office supplies

loans.name: Dios Es Mi Fortaleza Group

texts.es: Este es un grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ella es Jhoana se dedica a la venta de ropa usada desde hace un año, es una mujer casada, con dos hijos y tiene 43 años, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa usada, Blanca vende granos básicos y refrescos naturales y Flor vende ropa usada también.
texts.en:
This is a group of three enterprising members.  One of them, Johana, has been selling used clothes for a year.  She’s a married, 43-year-old woman with two children.  She will use the loan to buy used clothes.

Blanca sells basic grains and natural beverages and Flor sells used clothes too.

loans.use: to buy used clothes.

loans.name: Maria Tomasa

texts.es: María es una microempresaria de éxito es una mujer soltera, con 46 años de edad,  tiene cinco hijos su negocio es la venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado mayoreos tiene 29 años de tener su negocio, su hijo mayor le ayuda en la comercialización de los productos, inicia su negocio vendiendo frutas ambulante, poco a poco con sus ganancias adquirió un tramo en el mercado que ocupa actualmente y comercializa sus productos al por mayor. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de frutas como papaya, naranjas, sandias, guayabas de frescos, tamarindo y verduras como chiltoma, remolachas, zanahorias, cebolla dulce, papas, legumbres etc.
texts.en: María is a successful microentrepreneur. She's a 46-year-old single woman and has five children. Her business is selling fruits and vegetables at the wholesale market. She has had her business for 29 years and her eldest son helps her to sell her merchandise. She got her start as a traveling fruit seller, then she gradually saved money and purchased a stall in the market which is where she currently sells her wholesale products. She'll use the loan to purchase fruits such as papayas, oranges, watermelons, fresh guavas and tamarinds, as well as vegetables such as sweet pepper, beets, carrots, sweet onions, potatoes, legumes, etc.

loans.use: to purchase fruits such as papayas, oranges, watermelons, fresh guavas and tamarinds, as well as vegetables such as sweet pepper, beets, carrots, sweet onions, potatoes, legumes, etc.

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es: Gloria se dedica a la producción  de zapatos desde hace un año, tiene 36 años de edad con dos hijos y es una mujer casada, tiene dos trabajadores asalariados no familiares, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como charolina, pega blanca, pega amarilla, hebillas pequeñas, hebillas grandes, forros finos, montado, alistado, suela grande, suela pequeña etc.
texts.en: Gloria has been making shoes for a year. She's 36 years old and has two children. She's a married woman. She has two salaried employees to whom she's not related. She'll use the loan to purchase supplies such as patent leather, white adhesive, yellow adhesive, small buckles, large buckles, lining, lasting, sewing supplies, small soles, large soles, etc.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as patent leather, white adhesive, yellow adhesive, small buckles, large buckles, lining, lasting, sewing supplies, small soles, large soles, etc.

loans.name: Mildred Alejandra

texts.es: Mildred es una mujer empresaria con muchos deseos de superación tal es el caso que desde hace 11 años vende artesanías en su domicilio, tiene 32 años de edad, casada y con dos hijos menores. En  su negocio sus dos hijos le ayudan a comercializar su productos, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de artesanías como productos de chalinas, jarrones, hamacas grandes, carteras de cuero, fajas de cueros, bolsos tejidos, sapos disecados, pulseras tejidas etc.
texts.en:
Mildred is a businesswoman with a great desire for self-improvement, so she has sold handicrafts in her house for 11 years.  She's 32 years old and married, and has two minor children.  Her two children help her sell her products in her business.

She'll invest the loan in buying handicrafts such as scarves, vases, large hammocks, leather wallets and belts, woven bags, dried toads, woven bracelets, etc.

loans.use: to buy crafts

loans.name: Las Azucenas Group

texts.es: María es una microempresaria de éxito que unidas deciden formar un grupo solidario de tres socias, ella se dedica a la comercialización de carne de res ambulantes en las comunidades más cercana a su domicilio, y también vende en sus casa. De tener su negocio tiene 6 años es casada, y cuatro años de ser cliente de la institución, El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de carne de res. Ana  vende tortillas y  leñas y Dielka vende nacatamales en su domicilio.
texts.en: María is a successful entrepreneur and is part of a united group consisting of three members. She sells pork by foot in neighborhoods closest to hers. She also sells from her home.  She has had this business for 6 years, is married, and has been a part of the institution for 4 years. She will use the loan to buy more pork. Ana sells tortillas and firewood and Dielka sells tamales in her neighborhood.

loans.use: buy pork to sell

loans.name: Las Lideres Group

texts.es:
Grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras de éxito una de ellas es 
Gabriela tiene 34 años de edad,  soltera y un hijo menor,tiene 10 años de vender nacatamales y comida, inicia su negocio vendiendo nacatamales, actualmente realiza dos actividades en la venta de comida, cuenta en el negocio una trabajadora asalariado no familiar. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como carne de cerdo, hojas de chagüites, especies, mecates, mecates, arroz, etc. María Verónica vende nacatamales y Sonia vende cosméticos.
texts.en:
A group of three, successful enterprising members one of which is Gabriela, 34.  She’s single and has a minor son.  She’s been selling nacatamales [Nicaraguan-style] tamales and food for ten years.  She started out selling nacatamales and currently does both things selling food.  She has a non-family, salaried employee.  She will use the loan to buy raw materials like pork, banana leaves, spices, rope, rice, etc.  

María Verónica sells nacatamales and Sonia sells Cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and supplies.

loans.name: Santiago Felipe

texts.es: Don Santiago es un microempresario de éxitos es agricultor y tiene una pequeña granja de crianza de pollos  desde hace 8 años, es un hombre casado, dos hijos quienes le ayuda en el negocio, inicia su negocio vendiendo pollo y con las utilidades fue construyendo una galera que el hizo e inicia la producción de pollo actualmente, el crédito lo invertirá en la  mejora de una de las galeras que necesita reparación y mantenimiento como láminas de zinc, madera, malla ciclón, y 40 quintales de alimentos para la producción de 700 pollos.
texts.en: Santiago is a successful micro businessman.  He works in agriculture and has had a small chicken farm for 8 years.  He’s married and has two children who help him in the business.  He started out selling chicken and used profits to gradually build a chicken coop that he now uses to produce chickens.  He will use the loan to improve one of the coops that needs repair and maintenance.  He will buy metal sheeting, lumber, cyclone fencing and 40 quintals of feed to produce 700 chickens.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting, lumber, cyclone fencing and 40 quintals of chicken feed.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase corn, beans, potatoes, yucca, chayote, onions, green pepper, meat, chicken and cold cuts for her business.

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es:
La señora  Ana de 28 años de edad, esta casada y tiene 2 hijos  y vive en su propia casa  de habitación junto a su esposo en un  municipio de Choluteca, al  sur de Honduras. Se dedica desde hace más de 6 años ala elaboración y venta de hamacas de hilo, hamacas de seda, hamacas de lazo de todos los tipos y tamaños.
Doña Ana sus ventas son diarias de lunes a domingo en su negocio, sus clientes son las personas que viajan hacia la capital de Honduras ya que su negocio lo tiene ubicado en la orilla de la calle pavimentada. 
Doña Ana está solicitando el  para la compra de materiales para elaborar hamacas como ser hilos, lona, nilón, ceda, agujas y tijeras.  Y así  surtir más su negocio con el apoyo del préstamo espera lograra surtir un poco su negocio y por ende mejorar sus ingresos y su mayor deseo es seguir trabajando con la Prisma. 
Doña Ana su sueño es  mantener su negocio bien surtido y vender  por mayor todo su producto. 


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Enero -2013
texts.en:
Ana, 28, is married and has two children; she lives in a house of her own with her husband in the town of Choluteca in southern Honduras.  For the last six years she’s been working making and selling thread hammocks, silk hammocks and rope hammocks in all types and sizes.

Ana’s sales are daily from Monday to Sunday.  Her customers are people who travel to the capital of Honduras since her business is located on the edge of a paved street.  

Ana is asking for the loan to buy materials like thread, canvas, nylon, silk, needles and scissors to make hammocks and better stock her business.  With support from the loan she hopes to stock her business better thus improving her income.  Her greatest wish is to continue working with Prisma.  Ana’s dream is to keep her business well-stocked and to sell all her products at wholesale.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - January-2013

loans.use: to buy thread, canvas, nylon, silk, needles and scissors.

loans.name: Ibraham

texts.es:
El señor Ibraham de 36 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos en su casa  de habitación ubicada en una colonia al sur Honduras,  se dedica desde hace ocho años a la elaboración y venta de hamacas  de hilo, hamaca de seda, hamaca de cabuyas y hamaca de cáñamo, su negocio está ubicado a la orilla de la calle pavimentada que es la conduce hacia la capital de la república,
Don Ibrahan es reconocido por su amabilidad con todas las personas que lo visitan en su negocio.
Don Ibrahan está solicitando el préstamo para compra de cabuyas de seda, lasos, sondaleza, hilos de nailon, etc. Para la elaboración de  hamacas.
Don Ibrahan con el apoyo de este préstamo desea invertir en su negocio y asi tener mejores ingresos que le permitan salir adelanta con su familia.
Don Ibraham su sueño es que su negocio sea uno de los más fuertes de su localidad.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Enero del 2013
texts.en:
Ibraham, 36, lives with his wife and two children in his house located in a neighborhood in southern Honduras.  For the last 8 years he’s worked making and selling thread hammocks, silk hammocks, rope hammocks and hemp hammocks. His business is located alongside a paved street that leads to the national capital.  Ibraham is well-known by all who visit his business for his kindness.  He’s asking for a loan to buy silk ropes, ropes, lead lines, nylon thread, etc. to make hammocks.  With support from this loan he hopes to invest in his business to earn higher income.  His dream is that his business will become one of the strongest in his locality.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - December,  2013

loans.use: to buy silk cord, ropes, lead lines, nylon thread, etc.

loans.name: Julia Bernardina

texts.es:
La señora Julia de 48 años es casada vive en su casa de habitación junto con sus hijos de edades entre veinte y dos y veinte y cinco años,  vive en  un municipio de San Lorenzo  al sur de Honduras.
Doña Julia se dedica desde hace 08 años a la elaboración y venta de pan y rosquillas como quesadillas, hojaldras,  tustacas, también elabora nacatamales de cerdo y nacatamales de pollo,  toda  esta actividad forman parte de sus ingresos, sus clientes son los vecinos y amigos de su colonia.
Doña Julia está solicitando el préstamo para compra de harina para pan, huevos, azúcar, carnes de cerdo y pollo y leña. Con el apoyo de este préstamo  desea invertirlo en su negocio  y  de igual forma mejorar sus ingresos.
Doña Julia su sueño es  tener su propia panadería.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Enero  del 2013
texts.en:
Señora Julia is 48 years old. She is married and lives with her children, whose ages are between 22 and 25. She lives in the town of San Lorenzo, in the south of Honduras.

Doña Julia has been working for eight years preparing and selling bread and rosquillas (cheesy, doughnut-shaped snacks), as well as quesadillas, pastries, and tustacas (Honduran corn-based cookies). She also makes pork and chicken nactamales (steamed corncakes). Each of these activities makes up a part of her income. Her customers are her neighbors and friends from her town. 

Doña Julia is applying for the loan to purchase flour for bread, eggs, sugar, pork, chicken, and firewood. With the help of this loan, she wants to invest in her business and in the same way improve her income.

Doña Julia's dream is to have her own bakery.

San Lorenzo -- January, 2013

loans.use: to buy flour to make bread, eggs, sugar, pork, chicken, and firewood for her business.

loans.name: 5 De Marzo  (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 5 De Marzo se reúne cada quince días en Portoviejo ciudad bella y hospitalaria conocida como la Ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, con muchos atractivos turísticos y con una variedad exquisita en su gastronomía.

Este es un grupo formado por 12 mujeres y dos varones los mismos que ya hace tiempo atrás decidieron unirse y recibir la ayuda que el banco les da con los créditos, ellos se dedican a diversas actividades como el comercio, venta de comida y también a la prestación de servicios.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Katty, tiene 28 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 9 y 5 años que estudian en la escuela. Su esposo es albañil.

Doña Katty es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes, la mayor parte de sus ventas son bajo pedido. Trabaja todos los días más que todo en las mañanas ya que a esa hora sus hijos están en la escuela, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Tiene 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad y  gracias a sus ganancias salen adelante ya que en ocasiones su marido esta varios días sin trabajo.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de playa que es lo que más  se vende en esta temporada. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe del banco. 

Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The “5 de Mayo” communal bank meets every two weeks in Portoviejo, a beautiful, hospitable city known as “City of the Royal Tamarinds,” that has many tourist attractions and a varied, delicious cuisine.

This is a group of 12 women and two men who decided some time ago to join together to receive the help the bank gives by means of loans.  They carry out a variety of activities like commerce, food sales and some are service providers.

One of the members of this group is Katty, 28.  She’s married and has two children who are 9 and 5 years of age and attend school.  Her husband’s a bricklayer.

Katty’s a housewife who in order to earn her own income works selling all types of clothes door to door and also at home where her customers come by.  Most of her sales are based on prior orders.  She works every day mostly in the morning which is when her children are in school.  She sells on credit and collects payment every fifteen days.  She goes to Guayaquil to buy merchandise whenever she needs to.  She’s been in this activity for four years and thanks to her profits they get ahead because sometimes her husband is without work for several days.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise like pants, blouses, shirts and beach clothes which is what sells most this season.  She’s been in the communal bank since its start and she likes it because of the help she gets from it.  Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Rosa Victoria

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa forma parte del banco comunal El Cisne desde hace 9 años tiempo en el que ha fortaleciendo la amistad y hermandad entre todas sus vecinas y amigas. Vive por los alrededores de la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, lugar que tiene clima frió, su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo antiguo y lo moderno, su producción agrícola en su mayor parte es para el consumo de sus hogares, laboran en la crianza de animales, El Valle ha tenido un gran crecimiento comercial. Su gente al igual que todas socias son personas amables, gentiles y aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. Rosa tiene 55 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 9 hijos, seis de sus hijos son casados y viven independientes, sus tres hijos solteros trabajan y estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo se dedica a la construcción labora como albañil, la casa en la que viven es su propia.

Doña Rosa se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y al cultivo de sus terrenos, sus cosechas son para el consumo de su hogar y si existe un sobrante lo vende, también se dedica a la cría y venta de cerdos, pollos y ganado. 

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos, pollos y alimento para animales.

Su meta es continuar creciendo en la crianza de estos animales.
texts.en:
Rosa has been a member of the “El Cisne” (The Swan) communal bank for nine years and has been strengthening the friendship and solidarity among her neighbors and girlfriends since then.  She lives around El Valle Parish in Cuenca, a place with a cold climate.  Its architecture is a mixture of the old and the modern.  For the most part, agricultural production is for home consumption and they work raising animals.  El Valle has grown commercially.   Its residents like the members are kind, gracious people who still retain the culture and traditions of its peoples.

Rosa’s 55-years-old, married and has conceived nine children.  Six of them are married and live independently.  Her three single children work and attend a local school.  Her husband works in construction as a bricklayer and the house they live in is theirs.

Rosa does household chores and works her land; her crops are for home consumption and if there is any leftover she sells it.  She also raises pigs, chickens and cattle to sell.

She will use her new loan to buy pigs, chicks and animal feed.  Her goal is to continue raising animals.

loans.use: to buy pigs, chicks and animal feed.

loans.name: Gloria Margarita

texts.es:
La Señora Gloria se encuentra en el tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal El Cisne, Vive por los alrededores de la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, lugar que tiene clima frió, su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo antiguo y lo moderno, su producción agrícola en su mayor parte es para el consumo de sus hogares, laboran en la crianza de animales, El Valle ha tenido un gran crecimiento comercial. Su gente al igual que las socias son personas amables, gentiles y aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. 

La Señora. Gloria tiene 25 años, es madre soltera 3 niños de 6, 4 y 3 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en la escuela y sus dos hijos más pequeños están en guardería. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su madre con quien comparte los gastos de del hogar. 

Doña Gloria se dedica a la cría y venta de cerdos, cuyes y gallinas las cuales las vende en su comunidad. También cultiva sus terrenos y lo que cosecha es para el consumo de su hogar.  En su casa se dedica a la elaboración de bordados ya esta actividad aprendió gracias a una amiga

Este crédito lo va a in verter en la compra de alimento para animales y telas y también para pagar la operación de paladar de uno sus hijos.  

Su meta es darles a sus hijos la mejor educación para que algún día lleguen a ser buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Gloria is taking out her third loan with the “El Cisne” (The Swan) communal bank.  She lives around El Valle Parish in Cuenca, a place with a cold climate.  Its architecture is a mixture of the old and the modern.  For the most part, agricultural production is for home consumption and they work raising animals.  El Valle has grown commercially.   Its residents like the members are kind, gracious people who still retain the culture and traditions of its peoples.

Gloria’s 25-years-old and a single mother of three children who are 6, 4 and 3 years of age.  Her oldest son attends school and the two younger ones are in a day-care center.  She does not have a house of her own; she lives in her mother’s house and shares expenses with her.

Gloria works raising and selling pigs, guinea pigs and chickens in her community.  She also works her land and what she grows is for home consumption.  At home, she also works doing embroidery, an activity she learned thanks to a girlfriend. 

She will use this loan to buy animal feed and fabric and also to pay for one of her children’s palate surgery.  Her goal is to give her children the best education so that they will become good professionals someday.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and fabric and to pay for her son's surgery.

loans.name: Nancy Piedad

texts.es:
La Señora Nancy es socia fundadora del banco comunal El Cisne, todo este tiempo que ha pertenecido al banco comunal ha logrado establecer una gran amistad con sus vecinas y compañeras del grupo. Vive por los alrededores de la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, lugar que tiene clima frió, su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo antiguo y lo moderno, su producción agrícola en su mayor parte es para el consumo de sus hogares, laboran en la crianza de animales, El Valle ha tenido un gran crecimiento comercial. Su gente al igual que todas las socias son personas amables, gentiles y aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La señora Nancy es casada, tiene 38 años de edad, en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 18, 17, 8 y 7 años de edad, su primera hija vive independiente ya que es casada, su segunda hija pasa en casa ayudando en los quehaceres del hogar, sus dos últimos hijos están estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como operario en una carpintería, la casa en la que vive es propia.

Doña Nancy se dedica a la venta de cerdos desde hace 12 años, ha elegido este trabajo como fuente de ingresos para ayudarle a su esposo a solventar los gastos del hogar y darles a sus hijos una mejor estabilidad económica.

Su crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de animales, los cuales le dejaron buenas ganancias con las que pudo solventar muchos gastos de su hogar. Este crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos para continuar creciendo en el negocio
texts.en:
Nancy is a founding member of the 'El Cisne' community bank.  During her time as a member of the bank, she has become good friends with her neighbors and fellow group members.  She lives on the outskirts of El Valle parish, in Cuenca.  This is a cold-climate area whose architecture is a mixture of old and new.  Most of the farming that takes place is done to feed individual households.  People also raise animals.  El Valle has experienced a lot of commercial growth.  The local people, in common with all the members of this community bank, are kind, friendly people who maintain the culture and traditions of their ancestors.

Nancy is 38 years old, married, and has four children from her marriage who are 18, 17, 8 and 7 years old.  Her eldest daughter is married and lives independently.  Her second daughter lives at home and helps with the household chores.  Her two younger children are attending a local school.  Her husband works in a carpentry workshop.  They own their own home.

Nancy has been selling pigs for 12 years.  She chose this line of work as a source of income so that she could help her husband to cover their household expenses and provide their children with better financial stability.

Nancy invested her previous loan in buying animals which made her good profits.  She used the money to cover many of her household expenses.  She will invest this loan in buying pigs so that she can continue growing her business.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Vida Plena  (Paute) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal La Vida Plena está formado por 8 socias y 2 socios quienes viven por el sector de Uzhupud en el cantón de Paute, lugar que tienen un clima cálido y sus tierras son muy fértiles,  se cosechan las más hermosas flores y gran variedad de frutas. Su gente se dedica a la crianza de animales, son personas amables, gentiles y aun conservan la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Gabriela, este su segundo crédito en el banco comunal La Vida Plena al cual fue invitada por una vecina, le gusta este tipo de crédito porque unifican los lasos de amistad con sus vecinas y a la vez mejoran sus actividades económicas. 

La Señora. Gabriela tiene 25 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 6 y 4 años que estudian en una escuelita del sector. Su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que viven es  propia.

Doña Gabriela pasa el mayor parte de su tiempo en la casa realizando los quehaceres de su hogar, para ayudarle a su esposo a solventar los gastos de la casa se dedica  la cría y venta de cerdos y cuyes, también cultiva sus terrenos y lo que cosecha vende en el mercado.

Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para aumentar su granja y alimento para sus animales.

Su meta es darles a sus hijos la mejor educación para que lleguen a ser buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The village bank La Vida Plena is made up of eight women and two men who live in the Uzhupud sector of the village of Paute where the weather is warm and the land is fertile.  The most beautiful flowers and fruits are grown in this land.  The members of this group make a living raising livestock.  The members are friendly, humble, and conserve the culture and tradition of their villages.   

One of the members is Gabriela.  This is her second loan with the village bank La Vida Plena to where she was originally invited by a neighbor.  She enjoys these types of loans because they unify the bonds of friendships among her neighbors while also improving their financial situations.  

Gabriela is a 25 year old married woman with two children of six and four years old who are currently in grade school.  Her husband is a brick layer and they live in their own home.  

Gabriela spends most of her time at home taking care of the errands.  To help her husband with the home expenses she raises and sells pigs and guinea pigs.  She also cultivates and harvests their land to sell in the market.

She will invest this loan to purchase chickens to grow her livestock and will also purchase animal feed.

Her goal is to give her children the best education so they can become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and animal feed.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es: El Señor Emilio, es una persona de 51 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, alcanzo a estudiar la primaria, cuenta con seis dependientes económicos a cargo, los cuales son sus hijos. La actividad económica a la que se dedica el cliente es la producción agrícola, de tal forma produce papa 130 cargas y arveja 40 Arrobas la producción se desarrolla en sus propios terrenos, los terrenos mencionados están ubicados en la comunidad de San Isidro Bajo, al norte del Municipio de Tiraque a una distancia de siete km de la población de Tiraque. por otro lado el señor Emilio manifiesta ser una persona trabajadora y responsable que quiere superarse económicamente en la vida  y para tal efecto se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para compra de ganado, él quiere con estor mejorar sus ingresos por tanto también la calidad de vida de sus dependientes.
texts.en:
Emilio, 51, is single.  He managed to study in primary school.  He's responsible for six financial dependents, his children.

The work he does is agricultural production.  He produces 130 "cargas" of potatoes and 40 "arrobas" of peas [units of measurement].  He does this on his own land in the community of San Isidro Bajo, about seven kilometers to the north of the town of Tiraque.

Emilio shows himself to be a hardworking and responsible person who wants to improve himself financially in life, for which he sees the need to request a loan to buy livestock.  With this he wants to improve his income as well as the quality of life of his dependents.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Doña Francisca es madre soltera de 51 años de edad con dos hijos varones de 18 y 12 años, su padre los abandonó cuando el menor tenía un año de edad y desde ahí nunca más supieron nada de él. Ella desde joven trabajo en el municipio de Shinahota con su familia en la agricultura recibiendo contratos jornales en lotes agrícolas de piña, banano, yuca, maíz, arroz, papaya, etc, donde adquirió bastante experiencia. Actualmente doña Francisca trabaja con ayuda de sus dos hijos y hasta la fecha lograron ahorrar y comprarse su propio lote en una población alejada llamada Estaño Colorado del Municipio de Chimoré, para el cual ahora solicitan el crédito para la compra de insumos y tener su propia producción. La Sra. Francisca cuenta que esa siempre fue su ilusión para que sus hijos y las demás generaciones que vendrán no tengan que pasar lo que ella paso, y tengan una vida más tranquila.
texts.en:
Francisca is a single mother, who is 51 years old and has two sons of 12 and 18 years of age. Their father left them when the youngest child was one year old, from that moment they never again knew about him.

From a young age, she worked in the municipality of Shinahota with his family in agriculture, working in lots of pineapple, banana, cassava, maize, rice, papaya, etc, where she gained enough experience. 

Francisca is currently working with the help of her two sons. They have managed to save to buy their own lot in a remote village called "Estaño Colorado", in the municipality of Chimoré. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase inputs to have her own harvest. Francisca tells us that it was always her dream that her children and the next generations will not have to live the same life she had. She hopes they will have a more quiet life.

loans.use: to purchase inputs to have her own harvest

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.es: El señor Cirilo,  tiene 46 años de edad, es casado, vivía económicamente estable, pero por razones de problemas de salud de su hija, enfermedad heredada de parte de los ancestros epilepsia de tercer grado don Cirilo ha tenido que llevar a su hija a centros hospitalarios especializados para que puedan hacer un tratamiento y disminuir la frecuencia de ataques que se presente en la niña.  Por las escasas lluvias presentadas en la anterior gestión agrícola se ha reducido el caudal de las aguas subterráneas en la zona, por efecto don Cirilo ha perdido gran cantidad de su producción de tomate ya que la comunidad ha restringido el uso del agua a lo mínimo que no ha cubierto el requerimiento de agua para la producción el cual a ocasionando una disminución de ingresos económicos por venta de estos productos, es por estos motivos mencionados que la estabilidad económica ha sufrido un desequilibrio afectando directamente en la adquisición de los materiales e insumos requeridos para la producción como en la canasta familiar para la alimentación de los jornaleros que emplea. Para enmendar lo mencionado recurre a solicitar crédito con el objetivo de mejorar la calidad de vida y retomar el camino de la prosperidad, quiere comprar bueyes para ayuda de arado. También indica que año tras año ha reducido el líquido elemento resultado del cambio climático (calentamiento global).
texts.en: Señor Cirilo is 46 years old and married.  He had enjoyed stable finances, but due to his daughter's health problems (an illness inherited from her ancestors: third level epilepsy), don Cirilo has had to bring her to specialized hospital centers that can treat his daughter and reduce the frequency of her epileptic attacks.  Because of the scarce rainfall during the previous agricultural cycle, the subterranean water level in the area has been reduced.   As such, don Cirilo has lost a great quantity of his tomato plants.  The community has restricted water usage to a minimum, which hasn't been sufficient for his crops.  This has caused don Cirilo a loss of income, being unable to selling his products.  For these reasons, his financial stability has suffered an imbalance which has directly affected his ability to acquire the materials and supplies he needs for production, like being unable to buy food for the laborers that he employs.  In order to remedy all of the above, don Cirilo is turning to a loan request.  His goal is to improve his quality of life and to return to the path of prosperity.  He wants to buy oxen to help with the plowing.  He also mentions year after year water quantities have diminished as a result of climate change (global warming).

loans.use: to purchase oxen.

loans.name: Khalid

texts.en: Khalid is a 43-year-old, married man who lives in Taiz, Yemen.  He is a responsible man of 5 children.  He is also a teacher who is characterized as a kind man toward his students.  He receives a low salary which is not enough to provide for his family.  He intends to buy furniture for his house.  So he applied for a loan in the amount of 200,000 YER from AMB.  He hopes to live a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his house.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed lives in Ibb with his family. He has 5 children who attend school.

Mohammed is 38-years-old. He is a soldier who had an old motorcycle since 1990. He sold it and needs money in order to purchase a new motorcycle to satisfy more customers.  He is taking a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB. With the profits he will provide for his family's needs, while making his business sustainable.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle

loans.name: Dolores De Los Angeles

texts.es:
La Señora Dolores forma parte del banco comunal Las Flores desde hace 8 años, tiempo en el que su grupo ha llegado a ser como su familia, vive por la Parroquia de Paccha en Cuenca, lugar que goza de hermosos paisajes que se forman gracias a su geografía accidentada, su gente son de corazón cálido, amables y gentiles, quienes se dedican al trabajo arduo como es la crianza de animales, agricultura y muchos laboran en la ciudad ejerciendo varias actividades.

La Señora. Dolores tiene 51 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 20, 18 y 16 años de edad, su primera hija cursa los estudios universitarios, su segunda hija está estudiando en una academia de belleza y su tercer hijo estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo tiene un taller de carpintería, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Doña Dolores se dedica a los quehaceres de su casa, en el pequeño espacio que tiene lo utiliza para criar cuyes y pollos, también a diario a laborar en el taller de su esposo en donde trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo. 

Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de madera para la carpintería de su esposo y alimento para sus animales. 

Su sueño es tener un negocio de venta de comida.
texts.en:
Dolores has been part of Las Flores Communal Bank for eight years, during which time her group has come to be like her family.  She lives in the parish of Paccha in Cuenca, a place that has beautiful scenery thanks to its rugged geography.  The people there are warm hearted, friendly, and helpful, and they make a living in hard work such as raising animals and agriculture, and many work in the city doing various jobs.

Dolores, 51, is married and from this union has had three children, ages 20, 18, and 16.  Her first daughter studies in the university, her second daughter studies in a beauty academy, and her third child, a son, studies in a school in the city.  Her husband has a furniture shop.  They don't have their own house so they rent.

Dolores spends her time doing the housework at home.  She uses the little space she has to raise guinea pigs and chickens.  She also works every day in her husband's workshop where he works Sunday through Sunday without a set schedule.

She's going to invest her loan in buying wood for her husband's furniture shop and feed for her animals.

Her dream is to have a business selling food.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and wood

loans.name: Yenny Melania

texts.es:
Para la Señora. Yenny este es el doceavo crédito en el banco comunal La Flores, le gusta este grupo ya que en cada reunión salen de su rutina diaria de trabajo y puede conversar con sus amigas. Vive por un hermoso sector de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que goza de una arquitectura colonial, su gente es amable, gentil y de un corazón cálido, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. Yenny tiene 33 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal han concebido 3 hijos  de 11, 10 y 3 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos están estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión mecánico y labora en un taller, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive en casa de un familiar.

Doña Yenny se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y para aportar a la economía de su hogar trabaja en una panadería de lunes a viernes desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 2 de la tarde.
 
Su crédito lo va a invertir en los estudios de sus hijos, va a comprar libros y un computador. 

Su meta es tener su propia panadería.
texts.en:
This is Yenny's twelfth loan in Las Flores Communal Bank.  She likes this group because in every meeting they get away from their daily work routine and can talk with their friends.  She lives in a pretty section of the city of Cuenca, which has colonial architecture and friendly, helpful, and warm-hearted people who still preserve the culture and traditions of their communities.

Yenny, 33, is married and from this relationship has had three children, ages 11, 10, and 3.  Her two older children are studying in a school in the city.  Her husband is a mechanic by profession and works in a shop.  They don't have their own house, so they live in a relative's house.

Yenny spends her time doing the household chores and, to contribute to the household finances, she works in a bakery from Monday through Friday from 8 in the morning until 2 in the afternoon.

She's going to invest her loan in her children's studies; she's going to buy books and a computer.

Her goal is to have her own bakery.

loans.use: to buy books and a computer

loans.name: Luz María

texts.es:
La Señora. Luz se encuentra en su octavo crédito, forma parte del banco comunal Las Flores tiempo en el que ha estrechando su amistad con todas las socia del grupo, este grupo se caracteriza porque todas las socias tienen un gran carisma. Vive por la parroquia de Ricaurte en Cuenca, lugar que se mezcla su arquitectura antigua con la moderna, su gastronomía es muy variada, su gente es amable y gentil.

Doña Luz tiene 66 años, es casada y fruto de esa unión conyugal ha concebido 7 hijos quienes ahora son mayores de edad, seis de ellos están casados y viven independientes, su hijo soltero trabaja y le ayuda económicamente. La casa en la que vive es de su propiedad siendo el fruto del trabajo conyugal en su juventud, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

La señora Luz se dedica a la crianza de animales y también tiene una tienda en la que labora de domingo a domingo sin horario fijo, ha elegido esta actividad porque  puede ocuparse de su casa y a la vez ayudar económicamente para sacar adelante a su familia. 

Su crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de víveres para su tienda, del cual obtuvo buenas ganancias que fueron de mucha utilidad para su familia. Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más víveres para ampliar su negocio
texts.en:
Luz is on her eighth loan.  She's part of Las Flores Communal Bank, time in which she has strengthened her friendship with all the members of the group.  This group is known for all the members having a lot of charisma.  She lives in the parish of Ricaurte in Cuenca, a place where modern and old architecture are mixed, the cuisine is varied, and the people are friendly and helpful.

Luz, 66, is married and from this relationship has had seven children who are now adults.  Six of them are married and live independently; her single son works and helps her financially.  The house she lives in is her own property, the fruit of her labor with her husband in their youth.  Her husband makes a living in agriculture.

Luz makes a living raising animals and also has a store where she works from Sunday through Sunday with no fixed schedule.  She chose this work because she can take care of her house and at the same time help get her family ahead financially.

She invested her previous loan in buying supplies for her store, from which she got good profits that were of great help to her family.  She's going to invest her new loan in buying more supplies to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy provisions

loans.name: Hoern

texts.en:
Hoern, 63 years old, is widowed and lives in a rural area located in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. She has four children. Hoern has struggled to earn a living through farming rice, which she had been doing for thirty years. She earns about KHR 60,000 per day from the current business and is able to save about KHR 20,000 each day for the future.

Hoern has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan, which helped her family buy enough food. Now she is applying for a loan. With this loan, she is going to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and rice seeds for her farmland. 

She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice healthfully and fruitfully so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticides, and rice seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Tuy's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village of Battambang province’s Mongkul Borey district, Tuy is 62 years old, married, and has five children, one of whom is a dependent. For more than thirty-two years, she has been farming rice as a primary source of income and she can earn about 25,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

Tuy has been with VisionFund for three cycles while the other member has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Tuy has completely paid back the past loans which have helped her support her family as well as her current business. Now she is leading her group of two to ask for a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on laborers for plowing the field. She hopes to increase her crop yield to continue her family's progress.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland and pay for the labor to plow the field

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Kong is 43 years old and widowed. She has one child. To support the family, she has been raising pigs and selling groceries for four years. To earn more income, she has been involved in buying and selling rice in the local area. The current business earns her about 88,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs.
 
Kong has been with VisionFund for one cycle. She completely paid back the past loan which helped her to improve her family’s living condition. Now she is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 KHR to buy pig feed for nourishing them and use a portion of it to spend on buying more rice to resell. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income and expand her current business to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy pig feed

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Phat's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area in the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham Province, Phat is 60 years old and married. She has five children. The primary source of her family’s income is from rice farming. Her husband also complements the income by working for others for a fee to better support the family. She can earn about 34,000 KHR per day and manage to save about 12,000 KHR each day after the expenses.

Phat’s group consists of two members who live in the same village; she is in her first microloan with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Phat, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to get a high crop yield from her rice paddy that she can sell for a good price.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en:
Chantha, 59, lives in a rural village of Kandal province’s Kandal Stoeng district in Cambodia. She is married and has seven children. For the last 28 years, Chantha has been farming rice to support her family. The current business earns her about 26,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs. 

Chantha has been with VisionFund for four cycles, while the other members are new to VisionFund this cycle. Now she is leading her group of five to ask for a loan. As the leader, Chantha will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland, and she will use a portion of it to spend on labor costs in plowing the field. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yield so as to increase her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao, 46 years old, is married and lives with her family in a rural area located in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. She is a mother of seven children, three of whom are dependent on her and still in school. 

She earns a living through farming rice, which she had been doing for several years while her husband catches fishes to earn additional income for the family. Together, she and her husband can earn about US $14 per day from the current business and is able to save about US $4 each day for the future. 

Mao is in her first client cycle with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan. She is going to use her loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice healthfully and timely so as to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Samet

texts.en:
Samet lives in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She is 31 years old, married, and has two children. To support her family, she has been working as a rice farmer on a three-hectare farmland for more than 11 years. To supplement the income, she sells groceries in the local area. The current business earns her about 26,000 KHR per day, which allows her to save 10,000 KHR each day after expenses. 
Samet has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan which has helped her to relieve her family’s burden. Now she is requesting a loan of 1,200,000 KHR to buy a decent motor for a vehicle. She hopes this loan will enable her have a motor for her family to use.

loans.use: to buy a decent motor for commuting in her family

loans.name: Roth's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Sangke district of Battambang province, Roth is 40 years old and married. She has one daughter. The primary source of her family’s income is from planting vegetables such has chilies, cucumbers, etc. Having been in this business for twenty-five years, she can earn about 50,000 KHR per day to meet the needs of her family.

Roth’s group consists of two members who live in the same village. This is the first cycle for the group with VisionFund. Roth is leading her group of two to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her cultivated land and use a portion of it to renovate her old house. She hopes to get a high crop yield from her plantation to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her cultivated land

loans.name: Khom's Group

texts.en:
Khom, 52, lives with her husband and five children in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She and her husband have struggled to feed and care for their children by farming rice on five-hectare of farmland and fishing which they have been in the business for thirty-two years. Together, they can earn about 50,000 KHR per day and manage to save about 25,000 KHR each day for the future. 

Khom has been with VisionFund for four cycles and completely paid back the past loans. The previous loans have helped her to relieve her family’s burden and improve their lives.  Now she is the leader of a group of four and seeks another loan. Khom, who is the leader, will use her portion to pay the labor costs for harvesting rice. She hopes to increase her crop yield so as to extend her rice-farming in order to improve her living’s condition.

loans.use: to pay labor costs for harvesting rice

loans.name: Lean's Group

texts.en:
Lean is a 60-year-old mother of two children and earns a living through planting corn on a two-hectare area of farmland to support the family. She has been in this business for ten years and the current business earns her about 23,000 KHR per day to feed the family. Lack of working capital is the main challenge for her to better support the family’s business.

Lean’s group is composed of two members who live in the same village of the Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, Cambodia. Lean is working with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, this cycle, and is leading her group to request a loan. She wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer and corn seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her corn in order to sell it for a good price to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and corn seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Nary's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, Nary is now 37 years old and married. She has four children, three of whom are dependents and still in school. Nary and her husband are farmers who grow rice on five-hectare of farmland as their main business to support the family. Together, they have been in the business for twenty years.

Nary has been with VisionFund for seven cycles while the other members have been with VisionFund for four cycles. The past loans have helped her to provide her family with enough food. Now she is leading her group of three to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase the income for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Koern

texts.en:
A rural villager living in Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, Koern is 38 years old and married. She has been planting vegetables such as chilies, cabbage, and cucumbers, etc., to support her family. She has been in this business for 10 years. 

Koern has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan which has helped her to provide her family with enough food. Now she is applying for a loan of 610,000 KHR to start electrical service for her house. She hopes this loan will enable her to start electrical service for her house.  Having electrical power in the house will improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to start electrical power service for her house

loans.name: Seam's Group

texts.en: An elderly woman originally from Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Seam is a 60-year-old widow and mother of two children who live independently as they also have their own family. To support her daily living, she farms on two hectares of farmland. She has 10 years of experience involving rice cropping which earns her about 16,700 KHR per day. Head has been with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner for the past five cycles. She has used the past loan wisely to upgrade her living status and to improve her income, generating activities in a gradual manner. Now, she joins a microloan group consisting of two members. She is requesting 1,400,000 KHR, whereas her co-borrower is applying for 1,200,000 KHR. In this cycle as the group leader, she is going to spend her loan portion on potash, insecticide, and to pay for labor fees. She hopes to gain more yield than last year and make more income to sustain her living.

loans.use: to buy potash, insecticide, and to pay for labor fee

loans.name: Saminas

texts.en: Residing in Dambae district of Kampong Cham Province where cassava growing is a common business in the area,  Saminas is 34 years old and a mother of three children all of which attend the local public school. She is also a peasant who owns three hectare and grows cassava in order to survive and cover her children’s education. This is the business that she has been in for 9 years. For Saminas, this is the fourth loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. The past loans have supported her business and helped her provide for her family’s needs through a decent income from her business. Now, she is in need of working capital for her business. Therefore, she is seeking a new loan with VisionFund in order to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing fees and labor fees. She hopes to grow her cassava in a timely manner and have a fruitful crop so that she can set aside some money to build a big house for her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing fees and labor fees

loans.name: Nhoeb

texts.en: Nhoeb,42, is married and blessed with four children. She and her husband overcome the family's hardships via two hectares of rice cropping and one hectare of cucumber planting. To better feed the family, this couple also catches fish to sell. For the years that she has engaged in this business, she has been able to earn up to 20,000 KHR per day. Including this cycle, she is a fourth-time borrower with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She has fully paid back her loan, which helped her sustain her paddy growing and fish catching endeavors  and gradually earn a good income. Now, she wants to buy fertilizer for her farm. Therefore, she is seeking a new loan with VisionFund again. She hopes that she can boost her cash-crop productivity and receive a larger crop output to earn a higher income for her family’s sake.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Seab's Group

texts.en:
Seab is a 46-year-old, married woman from the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province.  She has six children.  Her husband builds houses and she makes a living working for others.  She has done this for the past 10 years and is able to earn up to 27,400 KHR.  Now she leads a group of three female members and is in the fourth cycle loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner.  

After successfully paying back in full, she feels empowered that she can maintain her lifestyle.  For this cycle, she and her co-borrowers are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each.  Seab will use her portion in order to buy a small wood shaving machine to support her husband’s business.  She hopes that this purchase will help them earn more income.

loans.use: to buy a small wood shaving machine.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Neang's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Prey Chor district of Kampong Cham province, Neang is married and 46 years old. She has four children (only one daughter) all of whom still count on her. To help her family survive she grows rice with the support from her husband on one hectare of farmland. It is the business that she has been in for 15 years and it has enabled her to earn 16,600 KHR per day. 

This is the third loan for Neang with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. Her past loans which she has fully paid back has supported her business and improved her lifestyle gradually. Moreover, she was able to buy household supplies such as a table, a closet, and a television for her family. Now, she is in a group of two and a group leader. She and her co-borrower are seeking for 1,000,000 KHR each. For Neang, she is going to use her loan to buy fertilizer and rice seeds. She will also use a portion of it to pay for plowing and transplanting fee, and pumping the water for her rice farm. She hopes to grow her paddy rice on time so that she can gain double yield and make more income.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and transplanting fee, and pumping the water for her rice farm

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Saman's Group

texts.en:
Age 54 and residing in Kampong Cham province, Saman is married with one child.  She and her husband manage one half hectare of farmland for growing rice.  She has been in this business for 35 years.  Her main challenge is the shortage of working capital to support her rice cultivation business.  Therefore, she leads a group of two in applying for a new loan with VisionFund to address this challenge.  Saman’s prior loan, her original loan, has already been paid in full.  She has managed to overcome her daily hardship and has helped to relieve her family burden.

For this cycle, Saman is applying for 500,000 KHR and her co-borrower is requesting 900,000 KHR.  She will use her portion to pay plowing fees and to buy fertilizer and rice seed.  She hopes to grow her rice seasonably so that she can make more income, lease additional farmland, and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and to pay for the plowing fee.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Chan's Group

texts.en:
Chan is a rural villager from the Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia.  She is married and blessed with two children who are currently students at the local public school.  To overcome her family’s difficulties, she cultivates rice on two and a half hectares of farmland.  Her husband is a paid construction worker.  The current business is the only business that she has been with for 20 years. 

She is a second-time borrower with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner.  Her previous loan helped her to relieve her family’s financial burden, especially daily food and education.  She now leads a group of three and is seeking a loan of 1,200,000 KHR for her portion.  Chan will use her loan to pay plowing fees and to buy fertilizer and rice seed.  She hopes to triple her crop output and to increase her income so that she can keep her children in school until the tertiary level.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and to pay for the plowing fee.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Preom's Group

texts.en:
Preom is a 44-year-old, married mother of five children.  She is a rural farmer living in the Ponkea Krek district of Kampong Cham province.  Her daily income comes primarily from two hectares of rice farmland and four and a half hectares of watermelon planting.  To supplement the family’s need, her husband also works for others in his spare time.  The current business, which she has been with for 22 years, earns her about 20,300 KHR per day.  

This is the first loan for Proem’s 4-member group, each applying for 1,000,000 KHR.  As group leader, Preom will spend her portion to pay the plowing fee for her watermelon farm.  She hopes to grow her watermelon seasonably, to increase her output, and to sell at a higher price in order to support her family.

loans.use: to pay the plowing fee for her watermelon farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Lat's Group

texts.en:
Lat is a 21-year-old mother of one daughter living in Kampong Cham province.  She manages two hectares of cassava, which she and her husband grow as their primary source of income.  She has been in this business for three years and is able to earn up to 35,600 KHR per day.  

Lat leads a group of first-time borrowers with VisionFund.  For her 1,000,000 KHR portion of the loan she plans to buy fertilizer, insecticide and labor.  She hopes to increase her crop yield and to sell it at a high price so that she can improve her lifestyle gradually.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and labor.

loans.name: Sy

texts.en:
Sy, 43, lives with her husband in a rural village of the Sampov Meas district of Pursat Province, Cambodia.  Sy has eight children, four of whom are dependent on her and still in school.  She has struggled to feed and care for her children by farming rice on three-hectares, a business she has been doing for 20 years.  Her husband works as a paid worker.  Together, they can earn about 22,000 KHR per day and manage to save about 14,000 KHR each day for the future.

Sy is with VisionFund and is applying for another loan of 3,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yield so that she may fulfill her dream of starting a new business and improving her living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en:
Sopheap, 34, is a widow who lives with her children in a rural village of the Kror Kor district of Pursat Province, Cambodia.  She earns a living as a rice farmer.  She also supplements her income by raising pigs and has been in this business for six years.  She earns about 10,000 KHR per day and is able to save half, after expenses, for future needs. 

Sopheap’s group consists of two members who have been with VisionFund for four cycles.  The previous loan has enabled her to buy a buffalo to help her in the rice field.  She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice so that she may have a better living.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo.

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham Province, Pov is now 43 years old and married.  She has three children, two of whom are dependents and still in school.  Pov and her husband are farmers who grow rice and plant frangipani flower as their primary business.  Having been in the business for twenty years, they are able to make a daily earning of 27,000 KHR and manage to save about 14,000 KHR each day. 

This is the first microloan for Pov with VisionFund and she leads a group of three.  Pov plans to use her portion to buy more farmland.  She hopes this loan will enable her to expand her farming business.

loans.use: to buy more farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice, fish, and other foodstuffs

loans.name: Alex

texts.es: El señor Alex  tiene 48 años, vive con su esposa Catalina su domicilio está ubicado en la comunidad de Alto Valle Nuevo a 25 km. de nuestra ciudad de Monteagudo. Ellos se dedican a la producción de maíz que es destinado netamente para el alimento de sus cerdos cabañeros que tienen. También cría ganado porcino cabañero en su pequeño galpón que tiene, ellos obtienen ingresos de la venta de sus cerdos para cubrir sus gastos de estudios, ropa, alimentación y otros que tienen de sus hijos, ellos están solicitando crédito para la compra de alimento de sus cerdos de crecimiento y lechones que tienen y necesitan alimento balanceado para que los engorden a los lechones y así pueden tener mayores ingresos que les permita estar más cómodos en su vida diaria y cubrir todas sus necesidades.
texts.en: Alex is 48 years old, he lives with his wife Catherine in their home in the Alto Valle Nuevo community, 25 kilometers from the city of Monteagudo.  They work cultivating maize [corngrain] intended purely for feed for their livestock pigs.  They also breed pigs in a small shed they have.  The revenue they get from the sale of their pigs covers their children’s education, clothing, food and other costs.  They are requesting a loan to purchase feed to rear their pigs and piglets.  They need nutritionally balanced feed in order to fatten the pigs so they can be more profitable.  This will allow them to lead a more comfortable life and cover the costs of all their necessities.

loans.use: To buy feed for their pigs

loans.name: Patricia Daniela

texts.es: La Sra. Patricia, tiene 34 años de edad y está casada con Edson, es una pareja relativamente joven,  no tienen hijos todavía, ellos viven a seis kilómetros de la ciudad  de Cochabamba, hacia el noreste no tienen casa propia aún, viven en alquiler en una habitación y su baño y trabajan como técnicos cada uno en Empresas donde los salarios son reducidos y quieren mejorar sus condiciones de vida acudiendo al crédito para comprar tres máquinas:  una de soldadura, una amoladora y un taladro para que con ellas puedan trabajar los fines de semana en actividades de metalmecánica y reparación de maquinaria y equipos ya sean industriales o domésticos en lo cual el  esposo es experimentado y así crecer y tal vez independizarse con el tiempo formando un taller para la atención en servicios en esta especialidad, ya que la demanda de servicios según el criterio de ellos es amplia en la ciudad y sus alrededores.
texts.en: Patricia is a married 34 year old woman.  Her husband is Edson.  They are a relatively young couple and do not have children yet.  They live six kilometers from the city of Cochabamba in the northeast.   They do not have their own home as they rent their own home and bathroom.  They both work as technicians for a company where their salaries are not high so they want to improve their living conditions by using this loan to purchase three machines:  one for welding, one for grinding, and one for drilling.  With these tools, they plan to work on the weekends on their metalwork and machine repair.  They can work on either domestic or industrial machines as the husband has experience.  With this they plan to improve their lives and become independent of their company while eventually opening a workshop to service machines in their specialty.

loans.use: to purchase a welder, grinder, drill, and other tools.

loans.name: Sergio Diego

texts.es: El Sr. Sergio se dedica a su actividad de Transporte Publico hace 4 años, es casado y tiene una sola hija y su esposa espera otro bebe que nacerá estos días, por ello le urge seguir trabajando con su movilidad ya que por ahora esta en reparación la parte del motor, para ello necesita el crédito que solicita para poder refaccionar el motor de su vehículo, de esa manera podrá percibir sus ingresos, además quiere ahorrar para poder comprar un lote para que pueda vivir junto a su familia mas cómodamente ya que ahora no tiene un espacio muy amplio para que puedan estar mas cómodos, especialmente su hija quien ya estudia y necesita un espacio libre para que pueda desarrollar de mejor manera sus tareas que se le dan en la escuela, además para que el mismo cliente junto con su esposa le ayuden con  la elaboración de los mismos.
texts.en:
Sergio has been a taxi driver for four years. He is married and has just one daughter. His wife is expecting another baby that will be born soon. This is why she encourages him to continue working with his taxi. At the moment, the engine is being repaired. For this he needs the loan that he is applying for, in order to repair his vehicle's engine. This way, he will be able to earn his income. 

In addition he wants to save to buy a lot, so that he and his family can live more comfortably. Presently, he does not have a very large space, that would allow them to be more comfortable. This is especially important for their daughter, who already goes to school and needs a free space so that she can properly do the homework that they give her in school, and also so that the client and his wife can help her do it.

loans.use: To repair the engine of his vehicle.

loans.name: Las Hijas De Maria Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Las Hijas de María” en la ciudad del Cusco de la provincia de Cusco del departamento del Cusco. Este banco comunal está conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de los socios son por ejemplo; churros, carpintería, artesanía, librería, productos de primera necesidad.   

La socia Ninoska nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella tiene 32 años de edad es padre y madre para su único hijo. Su actividad económica principal de la Ninoska es la venta de productos de primera necesidad y licores. Ya son 3 varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Ninoska requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo rones, piscos, whiskys,  y otras cosas más. Su sueño de la señora es abrir otra licorería.  

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. 

Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas y se caracteriza por ser una zona turística por sus centros arqueológicos por su centro histórico por sus paisajes por su historia y siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región del Sur del país. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends formed the communal bank “LAS HIJAS DE MARIA”. The bank is located in the district of Cuzco, in the province and department of Cuzco. This communal bank is made up of people that are constantly seeking out opportunities to get ahead, and through their daily efforts give their children a better future.  The other members' businesses are selling churros,carpentry,handmade crafts,a bookstore, and a grocery store.

Ninoska lives in Cusco, the same city in which she was born.  She is 32 years old and has the role of mother and father to her only child.
