Elizabeth fue siempre muy humilde, por lo que desde niña trabajo vendiendo refrescos para poder ayudar a sustentar a su familia económicamente  pero  con el pensamiento de seguir adelante y superarse cada día mas , es que en ese sentido  curso el colegio desde la primaria hasta culminar la secundaria saliendo bachiller y se dedico al comercio, querer superarse  en la vida y tener un terrenito propio donde  pueda realizar su actividad de manera independiente y tener una vida mucho mejor sin tener que pasar necesidades es que en ese sentido que necesita el préstamo para poder ampliar mas su actividad económica que es la venta de bebidas multivitamínicos.
texts.en:
Mrs Elizabeth and her family started this business facing a lot of difficult situations. Her family did not have enough economic resources when she was a kid, so she had to work selling beverages in order to contribute to her families’ support. However, they were always thinking of ways to get ahead in life with their families and improve their situation every day more.

She finished high school and after graduating she became a salesperson. She wanted to succeed and be able to buy her own land in order to develop independently and have a better life, without difficulties.

She is now requesting a loan from the institution in order to expand her business of multi-vitamin drinks.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de frutas,la socia vende manzanas,platanos,naranjas y uvas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las frutas.La socia solicita el credito para comprar manzanas,platanos,naranjas y uvas al por mayor.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Cleofe continues working in her fruit selling business. She sells apples, plantains, oranges, and grapes. She works from 8:00am until 6:00pm. She has been in this business for 5 years and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to have a store where she could sell her fruits. She is requesting the loan to buy apples, plantains, oranges, and grapes at wholesale price.

Cleofe is grateful for the loan that has been granted her, and she pledges to comply with the repayment plan.

loans.use: to buy apples, plantains, oranges, and grapes at wholesale price.

loans.name: Asunta

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de picanteria,la socia preparar platos como cuy al horno,pollo al horno y caldo de pollo,la socia se dedica al negocio 7 años y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener una picanteria mas amplio.La socia solicita el credito para comprar productos de cocinar como pollo,carne y verduras.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Asunta continues running her small restaurant, where she prepares delicious dishes, including roasted guinea pig, chicken soup and many others. She now has seven years of experience at her restaurant, and business is going well. Her dream is to grow and expand her restaurant, and she plans to use the support from this loan to purchase food items for preparing her dishes, including chicken, red meat and vegetables.

Asunta is grateful for this opportunity, and promises to complete all scheduled loan repayments on time.

loans.use: to purchase food items for her restaurant, such as chicken, red meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de platanos y ocas al horno que es un producto parecido a la papa,la socia vende en forma ambulatoria desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los platanos y ocas.La socia solicita le credito para comprar platanos y ocas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sofia is continuing with her business selling baked bananas and baked ocas, which is a product that is very similar to a potato.  She works as a street vendor from 9am until 4pm.  She has already had this business for 5 years, and it is doing very well.  Sofia's dream is to have her own shop where she could sell her bananas and ocas.  She is requesting a loan to buy bananas and ocas.

Sofia is happy to be receiving this loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy bananas and ocas (Andean tubers)

loans.name: Nicasia

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de golosinas,la socia vende galletas,dulces y chocolates,la socia vende en forma ambulatoria,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar galletas,dulces y chocolates.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Nicasia continues working in her business selling sweets. She sells cookies, sweets, and chocolates. She is a street vendor. She works from 8:00am until 6:00pm. She has been in this business for 7 years and it is going well for her. Her dream is to have a small grocery store. She is requesting the loan to buy cookies, sweets, and chocolates. 

Nicasia is grateful to those who are a part of her dream through this loan and she pledges to comply with the established repayment plan.

loans.use: to buy cookies, sweets, and chocolates

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio transporte,el socio hace servicio de taxi,el socio trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hastas las 10:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño del socio es tener un carro nuevo.El socio solicita el credito para comprar llantas para su carro.


El socio está contento con el crédito otorgado y agradece a los inversionistas de kiva.
texts.en: This member still works in the transport business. He works in taxi service. He works from 6 am until 10 pm. He has been in this business for eight years and it is going very well for him. His dream is to have a new car. He is applying for the loan to buy tires for his car. This member is happy for the loan and is grateful to the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy tires for his car.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de costura,la socia tiene un taller donde confecciona pantalones,vestidos de fiesta y faldas,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar su taller de costura.La socia solicita el credito para comprar telas e hilos.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Saturina continues working in her sewing business. She has a workshop where she makes pants, party dresses, and skirts. She has been in this business for 7 years and things are going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her sewing shop. She is requesting the loan to buy fabrics and threads.

Saturina is very satisfied with and grateful for the support that she will be given through this loan and she pledges to comply with the established repayment plan.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and threads.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de docencia,la socia es docente de un jardin de niños,al socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasa las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 6 años en este trabajo y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un colegio.La socia solicita el credito para comprar materiales como papeles,cartulinas y pinturas.

La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member of this communal bank works as a teacher.  She teaches in a kindergarten, working from 8am until 6pm.  She has been doing this work for 6 years, and it's going very well for her.  Her dream is to have her own school.  She is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as: paper, poster boards, and paint.  

She is pleased with the loan that is being granted to her, and she promises to make the payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as paper, posterboard and paint

loans.name: Máxima

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de quesos,manjares y yogures,la socia elabora estos productos y lo vende en forma ambulatoria,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los quesos,manjares y yogures.La socia solicita el credito para comprar leche de vaca.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Máxima continues her business making and selling cheeses, sweets and yogurts. She travels around selling her products, and now has eight years of experience in this trade. Business is going well, and her dream is to one day have her own store for selling her cheeses, sweets and yogurts. 

Máxima plans to use the support from this loan to purchase cow’s milks for making her products. She is grateful for this opportunity, and promises to complete all scheduled loan repayments on time.

loans.use: to purchase milk for making her cheeses, yogurts and sweets.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de ganaderia,la socia vende leche llevando a diferentes lugares como anta,la socia trabaaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de ganaderia.La socia solicita el credito para comprar un ganado y alimentos para los ganados.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower is continuing with her livestock business.  She sells her milk in different places, such as Anta.  She works from 8am until 6pm.  Her dream is to expand her livestock business.  She is requesting a loan to buy a cow and cattle feed.

She is pleased to be getting this loan, and promises to comply with the payment terms.

loans.use: to buy a cow and cattle feed

loans.name: Leocadia

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de leche,la socia vende en forma ambulatoria llevando a diferentes lugares,la socia tambien se dedica al negocio de venta de ganados,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender la leche.La socia solicita el credito para comprar leche.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Leocadia continues her work traveling around selling milk, and also makes a living selling cattle. She now has eight years of experience in this trade, and business is going well. Her dream is to one day have her own store where she can sell milk.

Leocadia plans to use the support from this loan to purchase milk for resale, and promises to make all scheduled loan repayments on time. She is very grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase milk for resale at her business.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de ganaderia,la socia cria los ganados los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias,el socio ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de ganaderia.El socio solicita el credito para comprar ganados y alimentos para los ganados.

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Mario makes a living raising cattle for resale in various markets. He has been working in this arena for eight years, and business is going very well. His dream is to grow and expand his cattle operation, and he plans to use the support from this loan to purchase cattle as well as feed for his herd.

Mario is grateful for this opportunity, and promises to make all scheduled loan repayments on time.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and feed for his herd.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de ganaderia y agricultura,la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva maiz y papa,la socia tambien los ganados los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las ferias,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de agricultura y ganaderia.La socia solicita el credito para comprar fertilizantes y semillas.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Cirila continues working in farming and animal husbandry. She has land where she grows corn and potatoes.  She also has livestock that she raises and fattens.  She then sells the livestock at the fairs.  She works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  Her dream is to expand her farming and animal husbandry business.

She requests the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

She is happy about the loan and commits to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de ganaderia,la socia los hace engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias,la socia ya tiene 5 años y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de ganaderia.La socia solicita el credito para comprar ganado y alimentos para los ganados.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sabina continues her work raising cattle for resale in local markets, and now has five years experience in this trade. Business is going well, and her dream is to expand and grow her cattle operation. She plans to use the support from this loan to purchase cattle, as well as feed for her animals.

Sabina is grateful for this opportunity, and she promises to make all scheduled loan repayments on time.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and feed for her herd.

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de ganaderia,el socio tiene ganados que los hace engordar y los vende en forma ambulatoria,el socio trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene en este negocio 9 años,el sueño del socio es mejorar su establo y ampliar el negocio de agricultura.La socia solicita el credito para comprar un ganado y alimentos para los ganados.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Walter continues to work as a rancher.  He has cattle that he raises and sells as a street vendor and works from 6:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.  He has had this business for 9 years and his dream is to improve his barn and expand his farming business.  

Walter is asking for this loan so he can buy a cow and cattle feed.

He is happy to get this loan and is committed to fulfilling his repayment terms.

loans.use: buy a cow and cattle feed.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de ganaderia,la socia vende leche ya que sus ganados son lecheros,la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias,el sueño  de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de ganaderia.La socia solicita el credito para comprar  dos ganados y alimentos para los ganados.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower is continuing with her livestock business.  She sells milk, because her cows are dairy cows.  She fattens them and raises them, and then later sells them in the various markets.  Her dream is to expand her business selling cattle.  She is requesting a loan to buy 2 cows and to buy cattle feed.

She is pleased to be getting this loan, and promises to comply with the payment terms.

loans.use: to buy cows and cattle feed

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de quesos,la socia elabora los quesos y luego lo vende en los diferentes lugares,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 6 años en este negocio,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los quesos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar quesos.

La socia esta contenta con el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Lorenza continues her work making and selling various types of cheese in local markets and fairs. She has six years experience in her trade, and works hard daily from 8:00 every morning until 5:00 every afternoon. Her dream is to one day have her own store where she can sell her cheeses. 

Lorenza plans to use the support from this loan to purchase cheeses for her business. She is grateful for this opportunity, and promises to make all scheduled loan repayments on time.

loans.use: to purchase cheeses for her business.

loans.name: Sembrando Esperanza  (Tosagua) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Sembrando Esperanza  se reúne cada quince días en el cantón Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.

Este es un grupo formado por 13 mujeres y 1 hombre que decidieron unirse y formar este Banco Comunal que les sirve de mucho ya que con los créditos ellos van mejorar sus pequeños negocios. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, ganadería y la agricultura.

En este lugar vive la señora Eugenia,  tiene 29 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene dos hijos  de 9 y 7 años de edad,  los mismos  que estudian en escuela. Su esposo es agricultor.

Doña Eugenia es una muy buena esposa que para ayudar con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la cría de pollos para lo cual hace años atrás  construyo un pequeño galpón en el cual en la actualidad mete hasta 200 pollos por temporada.  También realiza el crédito para que  su marido lo utilice en su trabajo, él tiene cultivos de arroz, maíz y maní  y requiere en esta época de dinero para comprar abonos e insecticidas para tener una mejor cosecha en este invierno, ella por su parte en esta época no tiene muchos pollos porque en esta época por el invierno tiene perdidas y por eso no arriesga mucho,  cuando los pollos están grandes los entrega a comerciantes y tiendas de la localidad. 

Este crédito es para comprar fertilizantes y abonos para así obtener muy buena cosecha. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le dan con los créditos. 

Su Su sueño es que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Sembrando Esperanza" [sowing hope] meets every two weeks in the Tasagua district.  This place is known to be very dynamic and the majority of it's residents work in farming and in raising livestock, due to the area's large amount of vegetation.

This is a group made up of 13 women and 1 man who decided to come together and form this communal bank.  It is very helpful to them, since with the loans they receive they will improve their small businesses.  They work in various fields, including retail, ranching, and farming.

Eugenia lives in this place.  She is 29-years-old, married (common-law), and has two children in school (9 and 5 years of age) with her husband, who is a farmer.

Eugenia is a very good wife and helps with the household expenses by raising chickens.  Years ago, she built a small chicken coop that fits 200 chickens per season.

In addition, she is taking out this loan so her husband can use it in his work.  He has crops of rice, corn, and peanuts and at this time needs money to buy fertilizer and insecticide in order to have a better harvest this winter.  She for her part doesn't have many chickens during this time because during this time of year she loses chickens.  For this reason, she doesn't take the risk.  When the chickens are large she delivers them to local traders and stores.

This loan is to buy fertilizer and manure in order to have a very good harvest.  She has been with this community bank since it's opening and is glad for the help that it always gives her with loans.

Her dream is that her children complete their studies.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Las Acasias  (Junín) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Las Acacias se reúne cada quince días en las afueras del  cantón Junín, esta ciudad  se la conoce por su gente amable y trabajadora y porque en este lugar se destila el mejor aguardiente de la provincia y del  Ecuador.

Este es un grupo de 14 mujeres y 1 hombre que decidieron unirse y formar este Banco Comunal que les sirve de mucho ya que con los créditos, ellos están mejorando sus pequeños negocios que tienen. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, servicios, venta de comidas entre otras actividades.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Trinidad, tiene 43 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 17 años  que estudia en el colegio. Su marido es albañil.

Dorna Trinidad con la finalidad de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de alimentos, ella tiene un pequeño restaurante en su casa en el cual prepara deliciosos platos, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 14h00 ya que solo prepara desayunos y almuerzos, su hijo le ayudan en su trabajo cuando puede, ella vende en su casa y también entregar almuerzos a domicilio. Tiene tres años con su restaurante y es así como en ocasiones salen adelante ya que su marido en ocasiones se queda sin trabajo y si no fuera por su negocio no tendrían  para la comida se su hogar.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar arroz, pescado y otros víveres para preparar sus deliciosos platos. Este es su primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal, ella ya estaba en otro grupo pero se cambio a este por estar más cerca de su hogar. 

Sus metas son seguir adelante en el banco y lograr los beneficios que este brinda.
texts.en:
The Community Bank Las Acasias meets every two weeks in the outskirts of the town of Junín, a city that is known for its kind, hardworking people, and as the home of the finest distilled liquor in its province and in all of Ecuador.

The Community Bank group is made up of 14 women and 1 man who decided to come together in support of one another and their respective small business. The group members make a living in various trades and areas, including services, food sales and other industries.

One of the group members is Trinidad, who is 43 years old and lives with her husband, who is a mason, and their son, who is 17 and attends high school.

Trinidad operates a small restaurant and sells various food dishes in order to help her husband with household expenses. She cooks delicious meals, and works seven days a week from 6:00 in the morning until 2:00 in the afternoon preparing breakfasts and lunches for her customers. Trinidad sells her food dishes from her home, and also delivers meals to customers. Her son helps her in the restaurant when he can. Trinidad now has three years of experience running her restaurant, and she is very grateful for this source of income, as her husband works on a contractual basis and is sometimes without work. If it weren’t for her work and business, they would be in a very tight spot.

Trinidad plans to use the support from this loan to purchase rice, fish and other food items for preparing savory dishes at her restaurant. This is her first year as a member of the Las Acasias group, though she was a part of another community group previously, but changed groups to be a part of one closer to her home.

Her goals include continuing her participation in the community bank, and taking advantage of the benefits and support structure there.

loans.use: to purchase rice, fish and other food items for her restaurant.

loans.name: 6 De Diciembre  (Montecristi) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 6 Diciembre se reúne cada quince días en Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

Este es un grupo de  11 mujeres y 2 hombres que decidieron unirse y formar este Banco Comunal que les ayudado de mucho ya que con los créditos, ellos han podido mejorar sus pequeños negocios y su calidad de vida ya que son gente muy humilde que vive de lo poco que ganan. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, servicios, venta de comidas etc.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Danny, tiene 33 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 13 y 11 años que estudian en colegio. El marido es agricultor. 

Doña Danny para ayudar a su marido con los gastos que genera el hogar se dedica al comercio,  vende ropa de todo tipo y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella recorre por toda la ciudad tres días a la semana más que todo en las mañanas ya que a esa hora sus hijos están en clases.  También  se va con su esposo a ayudarle en las faenas del campo y más en invierno ya que es cuando más siembra su marido. Ella deja a crédito a sus clientes y cobra cada 8 días, lleva tres años con este negocio y gracias a sus ganancias han salido adelante ya que la actividad del campo a veces no deja muchas ganancias.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de playa que es lo que más se vende actualmente. Este es su primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos.
 
Su sueño es ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The “6 de diciembre” communal bank meets every 15 days in the cantón of Montecristi, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts, which are recognized at the national and international level. It is the home of the famous hats made from palm fibers [so-called “Panama” hats]. 

This is a group of 11 women and 2 men who decided to come together and form a communal bank, which has been of great help to them. Because of the loans, they have been able to improve their small businesses and their quality of life. They are people of humble means who live on what little they earn. They work in a variety of businesses, such as sales, services, selling food, etc.

One of the members of the group is Danny. She is 33 years old. She is in a common-law marriage, from which she has two children who are 13 and 11 and who are studying in school. Her husband is a farmer. Danny, in order to help her husband with the household expenses, sells all kinds of clothing via door-to-door sales. She works all over the city, three days per week, usually in the mornings, since that’s when her children are in school. She also goes with her husband to help him with his labors in the fields, especially during winter, which is when he does most of his planting. 

She sells to her clients on credit and then charges them every 8 days. She has been in this business for three years, and thanks to her earnings, they have gotten ahead; the farming activities alone often don’t result in much income. She will use this loan to buy more merchandise, such as pants, blouses, t-shirts, and clothing for the beach, which is what is selling best at the moment. This is her first loan cycle in the communal bank and she likes it because of the terms for obtaining loans.

Her dream is for her children to finish their studies so they can be sucessful professionals.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, and clothing for the beach.

loans.name: Sosorbaram

texts.en:
Sosorbaram, 33, lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They reside in their own house on a plot of land. Sosorbaram’s wife works as an assistant teacher at a high school. His one-year-old son is cared for by his mother-in-law. 

During the winter, Sosorbaram sells coal to local people. From March to November, he provides transportation services between Ulaanbaatar and various other provinces on contract with a heavy-weight goods delivery business. 

He is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to purchase another truck for transportation purposes. The price of this truck is 10,500,000 MNT. Over the past years, he has saved 8,000,000 MNT and he is in urgent need of finding the remaining cash. 

The truck he hopes to purchase will be used by his father for freight purposes. As a result, the family will be able to generate more income and invest in their next generation’s education. 

Sosorbaram is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase a truck

loans.name: Erdenechimeg

texts.en: Erdenechimeg, 49 years old, lives with her two sons, daughter-in-law, and mother in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her elder son has a disability and gets pension from the state. Her younger son began working as a manager in October, 2012. She herself has been working as a cook since 2011 at a private business entity. The family resides in their own house on plot of land. The house they live in has deteriorated over the years and needs some serious repair. Also her automobile's spare parts are in need of updating because she used her automobile for long time without maintenance. So she is requesting a loan of 2500000 MNT to cover the costs of repair of her house and automobile by purchasing spare parts and construction materials. As a result, the family can live in a comfortable and warm place, and she can use her automobile for transportation purposes. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who cares greatly for her children.

loans.use: to purchase automobile spare parts and construction materials to repair her house.

loans.name: Geg

texts.en:
Geg, this fifty-eight-year-old man, lives in the northwest of Albania with his three grown-up children, his wife and his parents, according to Albanian family customs. 

Livestock has been the only activity he has been involved in for the past sixteen years, “As a business almost twelve years ago now, I applied for the first loan from VisionFund Albania, and since then I have received three in total. These loans were a godsend; without them, it would have been difficult to expand the activity and for this I am very grateful to the institution,” Geg said.

“I now need another loan to repair the stable because the land where the stable was built collapsed and the stable was destroyed as well due to this,” he continued.

loans.use: to repair the stable for his livestock

loans.name: Alba Limbania

texts.es:
Alba de 40 años, es madre soltera de tres hijos menores de edad. Debido a que su cónyuge la abandonó, se hizo cargo del bienestar de su familia. En la actualidad reside con su madre, la cual le colabora con el cuidado de sus hijos mientras ella labora para ganarse el pan diario. Desde hace 6 meses montó su propio negocio ubicado en la plaza de mercado de su localidad, en donde comercializa accesorios para celular, mecatos y bebidas. Labora diariamente de siete de la mañana a cinco de la tarde.
Su mayor sueño es garantizarles a sus hijos la oportunidad de ingresar a la educación superior, ya que desea que ellos tengan mejores oportunidades en el mundo laboral. 
Motivada por su gran deseo, Alba se encuentre solicitando un crédito que destinará para la compra de una nevera y surtido con el propósito de aumentar sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos, logrando una estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Alba, 40, is a single mother of three underage children. Her spouse abandoned her, so she took full responsibility of the family’s well-being. She is currently living with her mother, who helps her to take care of the children while she makes a living. She started her own business six months ago, which is located in the market square of her village. Alba sells accessories for cell phones, snacks and beverages every day, from 7 am to 5 pm.

Her biggest dream is to make sure her children can go to the university; she wants them to have better job opportunities.

Motivated by her dream, Alba is requesting a loan to buy a refrigerator and supplies for her store, with the intention of increasing her sales and improve her income. This will result in a more stable economic situation for her.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and supplies for her store (cell phone cases, snacks and beverages).

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de ganaderia,la socia los cria a los ganados y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias,la socia tambien se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de leche y queso,la socia ya tiene 6 años en estos negocios y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de ganaderia y venta de queso.La socia solicita el credito para comprar un ganado y alimentos para los ganados.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues to make a living in the cattle industry. She raises cattle and then sells them in various street markets. She always continues to make a living selling milk and cheese. She has made a living in these activities for the past 6 years and it is going well.

Her dream is to extend her cattle and cheese selling businesses. She is requesting a loan in order to buy cattle and cattle feed.

The member is happy about the loan and is committed to paying her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy cattle and cattle feed.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de ganaderia y agricultura,la socia cria vacas y luego las vende en las diferentes ferias,la socia tambien vende leche y lo vende a las diferentes personas,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de agricultura y ganaderia.La socia solicita el credito para comprar vacas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Leonarda continues working in her cattle and agriculture business. She raises cows and then sells them in the various markets. She also sells milk to various people. She has been in this business for 7 years. Her dream is to expand her agriculture and cattle business. She is requesting the loan to buy cows. 

Leonarda is happy with the loan and she pledges to comply with the repayment of her loan.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de ganaderia,el socio los hace engordar y luego los vende en las distintas ferias los ganados,el socio tambien trabaja como albañil y le va muy bien,el sueño del socio es construir un establo mas garnde para sus ganados.El socio solicita le credito para comprar un ganado y comprar alimentos para las vacas.

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues making a living in livestock.  He fattens the cattle and then sells them at various fairs.  He also works as a bricklayer and it's going very well for him.

His dream is to build a bigger stable for his cattle.

He's requesting the loan to buy cattle and feed for the cows.

He's happy about the loan and pledges to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy cattle and feed for the cows

loans.name: Barrio Sucre  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Barrio Sucre está constituido por 14 amigas y vecinas que viven por la parroquia Cumbe en Cuenca, lugar que goza de una geografía accidentada la misma que le regala hermosos paisajes, tiene un clima frió, su arquitectura es una mezcla de los antiguo y lo moderno. Su gente es de un corazón cálido, amable y gentil al igual que las socias de este banco comunal, aun conservan su cultura y tradiciones, su principal actividad económica es la agricultura, crianza de animales y comercio.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Gladys, es una socia fundadora del banco comunal Barrio Sucre, en todo este tiempo ha llegado establecer una estrecha amistad con todas sus compañeras. 

Doña Gladys tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 22 y 19 años que estudian en un colegio de la localidad. Su esposo labora como jornalero, la casa en la que vive es el fruto del trabajo conyugal.

La señora Gladys se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y a la agricultura, siembra hortalizas y sus cosechas son para  la venta y para el consumo de su hogar, también cría cerdos, cuyes, gallinas y ganado del cual vende la leche. 

Su nuevo crédito va a invertir en la compra de ganado y alimento para sus animales.

Su sueño es que sus hijos se preparen para que lleguen a ser profesionales.
texts.en:
The Barrio Sucre communal bank is made up of 14 friends and neighbours who live in Cumbe parish in Cuenca.  The area is geographically diverse, combining beautiful landscapes with a cold climate, and its architecture is a mixture of the old and the new.  The local inhabitants, like the members of this communal bank, are warm-hearted, friendly and kind and keep their culture and traditions alive.  Their main economic activities are agriculture, livestock breeding and trade.  

Gladys, a founder member of the Barrio Sucre communal bank, has built up a close friendship with her colleagues. She is 48, married and the mother of two children of 22 and 19, who are studying at a local school.  Her husband works as a labourer and the house in which they live is the result of the couple's hard work.  

Gladys shares her time between household chores and agriculture.  She grows vegetables, which are either sold or consumed by her family.  She also rears pigs, guinea pigs, chickens and livestock, whose milk she sells.  She plans to invest her new loan in the purchase of livestock and animal feed.  Her dream is for her children to be able to study for a professional career.

loans.use: to buy livestock and animal feed.

loans.name: Victor José

texts.es: El Sr. Víctor es una persona tranquila y trabajadora, concluyo el bachillerato pero no pudo continuar con sus estudios superiores ya que desde muy joven se vio en la necesidad de trabajar, de estado civil soltero, tiene una hija a quien le colabora moral y económicamente, es así que hoy solicita el presente crédito para poder sustentarse económicamente  el como a su familia, para esto requiere reparar el vehículo con el cual trabaja, actividad que representa su única fuente laboral, rubro en el cual lleva por más de 7 años indicando que el crédito solicitado le ayudara además a lograr el mayor de sus sueños el de poder contar a futuro con una casa propia y de esa forma mejorar la calidad de vida que lleva, ya que actualmente vive en la casa de sus padres quienes representan un gran apoyo para el Sr. Víctor.
texts.en: Victor is a hardworking and calm person.  He got a high school degree, but was not able to continue his education in college, because ever since he was very young he has had to work.  He is single and has a daughter, to whom he contributes financially and morally.  He is now requesting a loan so that he can support himself and his family.  He needs to repair the vehicle that he works with, as this activity provides his only source of work.  He's been in this line of work for more than 7 years.  He states that the loan that he is requesting will also help him to achieve his greatest dream: to be able to have his own house in the future.  This way he can improve his quality of life.  He currently lives with his parents, who are a great support to him.

loans.use: to repair and maintain his vehicle

loans.name: Eduarda

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de ganaderia y crianza de animales como cuyes y gallinas,la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias,la socia ya tiene 10 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas.La socia solicita el credito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los animales.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Eduarda continues with her business of raising cattle and animals such as guinea pigs and chickens. She raises and fattens them and then sells them in the various markets. She has been in this business for10 years and things have been going very well for her. Her dream is to have a place where she could sell her guinea pigs and chickens. She is requesting the loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens and feed for them. 

She is happy with the loan and pledges to comply with the repayment plan.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens and feed for them.

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de ganaderia y agricultura,la socia tiene un terreno donde siembra maiz y papa y lo vende en las diferentes ferias,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien.La socia solicita el credito para comprar semillas para su terreno de cultivo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member continues working in her agricultural and livestock business. The member has farmland where she grows corn and potatoes, and she sells them in various fairs. She works from 8:00 A.M. until 5:00 P.M. The member currently has five years with this business and it is going very well. She is requesting this loan to buy seeds for her farmland.

She is happy for the loan and she is committed to comply with her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: La Esquina  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal La Esquina esta formado por 10 socias y 1 socio quienes viven por la parroquia de Sinincay en Cuenca, esta parroquia tiene una hermosa iglesia, goza hermosos paisajes y varios lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza, su arquitectura es una mezcla de casas antiguas y modernas. Su gente se dedica al comercio, crianza de animales, agricultura y muchos trabajan en la ciudad ejerciendo diferentes cargos. Su gente es cálida, amables y muy gentiles que buscan la manera de sacar en adelante a  sus familias.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora María Angelita, se encuentra realizando su quinto crédito en el banco comunal La Esquina, tiempo en el que ha afianzado los lasos de amistad con todas sus amigas y vecinas.

La Señora. María Angelita tiene 52 años, está separada de su marido pero en su unión conyugal ha concebido 7 hijos, cuatro de ellos son casados y viven  independientes, uno de sus hijos trabaja y le ayuda económicamente y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. La casa en la que vive es de propia.

Doña María Angelita siempre esta  pendiente de su hogar y tambiem se dedica a la agricultura, lo que cosecha es para el consumo de su hogar, cría cuyes, pollos y cerdos a los que los vende en su comunidad. Desde muy pequeña aprendió a tejer sombreros de paja toquilla lo cual lo realiza desde su casa. 

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y alimento para todos sus animales. 

Su meta es acabar su casa ya que aún le faltan algunos acabados.

En esta ocasión en la foto del grupo esta una señora con pantalon amirillo que no pertenece al banco conmunal.
texts.en:
The communal bank La Esquina consists of ten female members and one male member who live in the parish of Sinincay in Cuenca. This parish has a beautiful church, beautiful landscapes and many places to enjoy nature. Its architecture is a mix of old and modern houses. Its people are dedicated to businesses, raising animals, agriculture and many of them work in the city with different positions. Its people are warm, friendly, and very gentle looking for ways to get ahead with their families. 

One of the members of this group is María Angelita, who is requesting her fifth loan in the communal bank La Esquina. During this time, she has strengthened the bonds of friendship with all her friends and neighbors. 

María Angelita is 52 years old, is separated from her husband but during her conjugal union she conceived seven children. Four of them are married and live independently, one of his sons works and helps her financially and her last two children are studying in a school in the city. She owns the house where she lives. 

María Angelita is always taking care of her home and she is also engaged in agriculture, growing for her own consumption. She breeds guinea pigs, chickens and pigs that are sold in the community. She learned how to weave straw hats from an early age and she does it from home. 

Her new loan will be invested in the purchase of chickens and feed for all her animals. Her goal is to finish her home, because some finishes are still missing. 

In the picture, there is a lady with yellow pants who does not belong to the communal bank.

loans.use: to buy chickens and feed

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de ganaderia,el socio les hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hast als 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de ganaderia.El socio solicita el credito para comprar un ganado y alimento para los ganados.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Rigoberto continues making a living in livestock. He fattens and raises the cattle and then sell the animals at different markets. He works from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m. and has been in the business for eight years, and it is going very well. He dreams to expand his livestock business and is requesting the loan to purchase cattle and animal feed. He is happy about the loan and promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and cattle feed.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de ganaderia y agricultura,la socia tiene vacas que son lecheras y tambien la leche vende en las diferentes lugares,la socia tambien tiene un terreno donde cultiva maiz y papa,el socio ya tiene 6 años en este negocio y le va muy bien.La socia solicita el credito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

La socia esta feliz ocn el credito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Filomena continues to dedicate herself to the livestock and agriculture business. She has milk cows, and she also sells the milk in different locations. She also has a plot of land where she cultivates corn and potatoes.

Filomena has been in this business for 6 years and it’s going very well for her. She is requesting the loan in order to purchase seeds and fertilizer. She is happy with the loan and is committed to fulfilling the payment quotas.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ganados que producen leche y tambien la socia vende leche en las diferentes ferias,la socia ya tiene 10 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de ganados.La socia solicita el credito para comprar un ganado y alimentos para los ganados.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member continues to work in her business of selling livestock that produce milk. She also sells the milk in various fairs. She now has ten years in this business and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her business of livestock sales. The member is asking for this loan to buy livestock and livestock feed. 

She is happy for this loan and she is committed to complying with her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy livestock and livestock feed.

loans.name: Andres Avelino Caceres Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “ANDRES AVELINO CACERES”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es  el señor  Yemi, el socio tiene 35 años de edad,01 hijos y es conviviente; él socio alterna sus actividades diarias brindando el servicio de taxi, el socio lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 07:00am hasta  las 07:00pm aproximadamente, , el socio es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que el socio saca adelante a su familia.

El socio solicita el crédito para el mantenimiento de su carro como en el cambio de aceite.
Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de tienda de abarrotes, venta de artesanía, venta de chicha, venta de golosinas, crianza de animales menores, imaginería.

La socia que sale en la foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde a al reunión.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the "Andres Avelino Caceres" communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Cusco, in Cusco province in Cusco department.

The member is Yemi. He is 35 years old, has 1 child, and lives with his partner. He rotates his daily activities providing a taxi service. He has been doing this work for years, and it is going well for him thanks to the effort that he puts into his business every day. He works Monday through Friday from 7:00 a.m. until approximately 7:00 p.m. He is a responsible and dedicated person, and this is how he moves his family ahead.

He is asking for the loan for car maintenance such as changing the oil.

The other members have businesses selling groceries, handcrafts, chicha (a traditional drink), sweets, and religious sculpture, and also raising small animals. The member who appears in the attached photo asked for permission to come late to the meeting. 

Yemi thanks those who are part of this dream through this medium, and he promises to make his loan repayments within the established schedule.

loans.use: to perform car maintenance such as changing the oil

loans.name: Moyopata-San Sebastian Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “MOYOPATA SAN SEBASTIAN”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de San Jeronimo, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Hilda ella es casada tiene 40 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas entre otros, la socia cría a estos animalitos  para luego venderlo a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia  lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cuyes para su negocio.

Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de carpinteria, transporte, venta de animales menores, venta de emoliente, venta de chicha.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the Moyopata San Sebastian communal bank. This bank is located in San Jeronimo District, in Cusco Province, Cusco Department. 

Hilda, 40, is married and has one child. She alternates her daily activities with a business raising small animals like guinea pigs and hens, among others. She raises these animals and later sells them to customers who order them. She has been in this business for years, and it is going well for her because of the effort that she puts into it every day. This is the way that she moves her family forward. 

Hilda is applying for the loan to buy guinea pigs for her business. The other group members work in carpentry, transportation, small animal sales, hot beverage sales, and chicha sales (a sweet drink made from purple corn). Hilda is grateful to those who are part of her dream and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise (clothing and shoes).

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en: Originally from Battambang Province, Chenda is a 45-year-old married woman with five children. Currently, only one of her children still depends on her as he is a schoolboy. To deal with the daily cost of living, she plants pineapples whereas her husband is a motorbike repairer in the local area. Her 12 years of experience in this business earns her about 42,100 KHR per day. This is her seventh loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. Her subsequent loans have enabled her to lift up her lifestyle gradually, and likewise her income-generating business. Now, she is short of working capital for her business, so she is seeking a loan of 2,000,000 KHR in order to buy pineapple seedlings, fertilizer, and to pay for plowing costs for her pineapple farmland. She highly hopes that she can grow a fruitful pineapple tree, which will return her a double yield and earn her a good profit.

loans.use: To buy pineapple seedlings, fertilizer, and to pay for plowing costs

loans.name: Dara's Group

texts.en:
Dara is one of the breadwinners in his family in theThmor Koul district of Battambang province. He has three children. 

Dara is a diligent local farmer who grows rice on two hectares of farmland with the support of his wife.  He been in this business for two years, and is able to earn up to 35,000 KHR per day. He is a second-time borrower with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. He has fully repaid the initial loan, so  he can afford to provide sufficient, decent food for his family, especially for his children.

The total of his group loan is 3,400,000 KHR; Dara will use his portion of 1,000,000 KHR to purchase fertilizer for his farmland. 

He hopes to gain more yield, so he can sustain his living condition.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his farmland.

loans.name: Sary's Group

texts.en:
Savy is 44 years old and married. She is blessed with five children and currently all of them are still in school. She and the rest of her family are residing in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. To survive, she and her husband raise pigs and own a vegetable garden. From the current business, she is able to earn up to 41,600 KHR per day. With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), Savy is a second-cycle client who has repaid her first loan completely.

The past loan has returned a decent income to support the daily cost of living and helped especially in keeping all of her children in school. Now, she is seeking for 1,200,00 KHR and one of her co borrowers is applying for the same amount. An additional borrower is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. Savy is going to use her portion to buy pig feed. She hopes to fatten her pigs to a healthy condition so as she can sell them with a high price to improve her living conditions and continue her children's education.

loans.use: To buy pig feed

loans.name: Bit's Group

texts.en:
A local cabbage farmer from the Sangke district of Battambang province, Bit is a 64-year-old father of three children. He has been involved in this business for 30 years and that has enabled him to earn up to  29,200 KHR per day in order to cover his household expenses. Bit has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the past five cycles and has fully paid back all the loans. 

The past loans have helped him to improve his business gradually so that he can manage to drill a well and to buy a water pump in order to water his cash-crop. Now, he has formed a group of three in order to apply for a new loan. Bit, as the group leader, is going to spend his portion to buy fertilizer and cabbage seed for his farmland. He hopes to grow healthy cabbage so he can make additional income in order to enlarge his farmland.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and cabbage seed

loans.name: Da's Group

texts.en: Aged 31 and a local citizen from Moung Russey of Battambang Province (Cambodia), Da is married and the mother of a little daughter. She struggles to cover the family’s hardship through rice cropping and chicken trading (buy and resell). Engaging in this business for 14 years, she is able to earn up to 20,300 KHR. This is the fourth time for Da with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Her past loans have enabled her to improve her lifestyle gradually and she has managed to pay back her previous loans. For this cycle, she is in a group of three female members. She is seeking for 1,000,000 KHR while her co-borrowers are applying for 1,200,000 KHR each. Da, as the group leader, is going to use her loan to pay for the harvesting fee and to buy more chicken for resale. She hopes to reap her yield on time so that she can upgrade her living condition progressively.

loans.use: To pay the harvesting fee and to buy more chicken

loans.name: Sol's Group

texts.en:
Sol is a 45-year-old widowed mother of three children, one of whom is still in school. They live in Battambang Province’s Moung Russey district. 

She manages her household expenses as a single mother through pig-raising and clothes selling, which she has been doing for ten years; this provides about 16,700 KHR. 

Sol has had four loans with VisionFund,  including this cycle. She has fully repaid her loan with success. The past loan has uplifted her living conditions gradually. 

Now, she is in a group of three members, alll of whom are seeking the same loan amount of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the group leader, she is going to spend her loan portion to buy more pigs for raising and clothes for resale. 

She has high hopes that she can raise her pigs well,  and replenish her clothes selling business on time, with a good income.

loans.use: To buy more pigs for raising and clothes for resale.

loans.name: Sileap's Group

texts.en:
Sileap is a peasant residing in Moung Russey District of Battambang Province with the rest of her family, which consists of five members including her three children. Two of her children are schoolchildren; whereas, the remaining one is too young for schooling. Her main source of income is from corn cultivation, and her supplementary income is from selling sweets in the area. She is able to earn up to 35,300 riels (KHR) per day from the current business that she has been with for five years.

Now, Sileap is leading a group composed of four-time borrowers including her. She has managed her past loan, which has been repaid, wisely and relieved her family burden steadily. She and her co-borrower are seeking the same loan amount of 1,400,000 KHR each. She will use her loan portion to pay a corn reaping fee. She hopes to collect her crop output in good time and sell for a high price. By doing so, she will be able to keep up good progress in her living situation and keep her children in school until the tertiary level.

loans.use: To pay a corn reaping fee

loans.name: Sinat's Group

texts.en: Sinat, 30, is a rural villager from Battambang Province’s Moung Russey district. She has two children, one schoolchild and one too young for schooling. To cover her daily food and other necessary expenses of the family, she owns one hectare of rice cropping farmland and another hectare of sesame planting land in addition to her current occupation as a school teacher in the local area. Involved in her current business for several years, she is able to earn up to 28,900 KHR per day. Now, she is a fourth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Her past loan that she has fully paid back has helped her upkeep her living standards gently. Since she is in need of working capital, she formed a group of four members to seek a new loan. She and one of her fellow group members are seeking 1,400,000 KHR each whereas the remaining two members are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each. As a leader, she will use her portion to pay for harvesting fees and to buy fertilizer for her sesame field. She hopes to gather her cash-crop yield on time and make more profit for her children’s sake.

loans.use: To pay for harvesting fees and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Nit's Group

texts.en:
Nit, a diligent local farmer from Moung Russey district, Battambang province, is 45 years old and blessed with four children. To overcome her family’s financial hardship, she has been farming for 12 years. She is able to earn up to about 29,000 KHR per day.

Her previous loan was the first for Nit with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She has smartly managed her first loan, with success, to improve her lifestyle gradually; in addition, she has repaid her previous loan already. For this new loan cycle, she and her co-borrower are seeking 500,000 KHR each. As a group leader, she will use her loan portion to pay for the harvesting of her crop. She hopes to collect her crop yield on time and gain more income.

loans.use: To pay for the harvesting of her crop

loans.name: Yon

texts.en:
Yon is 49 years old and a mother of two children. She lives in Dambae district, Kampong Cham province. She manages three hectares of cassava growing, with assistance from her husband, in order to ensure the survival of her family. The current business has enabled her to save about USD 4 per day, after deducting the living expenses.

For Yon, this is the second loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. Her first loan supported her business in a timely manner. Since she is again in need of working capital to support her businss, she is applying for a new loan. For this loan cycle, she will again use her funds to pay for labor, for weeding of her cassava field. She hopes to increase the yield, so that she can maintain her standard of living.

loans.use: To pay for labor, for weeding of her cassava field

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Me Mot district

loans.name: Poy

texts.en: Poy, 32, is a local farmer from Kampong Cham Province where cassava growing is one of the common business in the area. She has four children under her care and grows cassava on one hectare of farmland in order to support the daily needs for them as well as the rest of her family. To supplement the family income, her husband also works for other for a fee. For 14 years she has engaged in the current business. She is able to earn up to 22,200 KHR per day. With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), Poy is a third time borrower. She has managed her loans smartly to support her cassava farm. She is a applying for a new cycle loan with VisionFund in amount of 2,000,000 KHR in order to build a new house for her family. She hopes that she can own a proper house for her children so that her family does not need to worry during cold weather or the rainy season.

loans.use: To build a new house for her family

loans.name: Theary's Group

texts.en:
A 28-Year-old mother of three children from Kror Kor district of Pursat Province, Theary is a local farmer who grows rice on two hectares of farmland and raise pigs at home as the primary sources of income. To earn extra income, her husband spends his spare time working for others for a fee.  The current business earns her about 37,600 KHR per day and she has been doing this for 10 years. This is the third time for Theary with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).

She has fully repaid back her past loans which have afforded her decent meals for her children. Now, she is in a micro group of two. Her requested loan amount is 1,400,000 KHR while her co-borrower is seeking 100,000 KHR. Theary, as a group leader, is going to spend her portion to buy pig feed. She hopes that she can fatten her pigs well so that she can earn more income.

loans.use: To buy pig feed

loans.name: Thoy's Group

texts.en:
The mother of nine children residing in the Kror Kor district of Pursat Province, Thoy is 44 years old and makes a living by growing rice and grocery selling. She has 20 years of experiences in this business, and she is able to earn up to 26,300 KHR per day. 

Thoy is in the fifth loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  She has managed her past loan wisely, and it has gradually relieved her family burden. 

Now, she is a group of three to apply for a new loan. The total loan amount of her group loan is 3,100,000 KHR. Thoy's portion is 1,000,000 KHR; she will spend it on potash (fertilizer)  for her rice. She hopes this purchase will boost her crop productivity in a good manner, and double her yield.

loans.use: To buy potash (fertilizer) for her farmland.

loans.name: Savoun

texts.en:
Savoun, 50, is a rural villager from Srey Snom District of Siem Reap Province. Her main business is rice cultivation on two hectares of farmland, which she does to feed her five children, especially her four children who are still in school. For the 10 years that she has been involved in this business, she has been able to earn up to 10,000 Cambodian riel per day (KHR) and to save about 5,000 KHR per day.

This is Savoun’s second loan with VisionFund. She has successfully repaid her first loan and has improved her lifestyle gradually. Now, she wants to fix her house, to bring it up to an appropriate standard. She is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 KHR. 

Savoun hopes to have a decent house for her children so that she need not worry about her living conditions and can mainly focus on earning more income to support her family as well as keep her children in school.

loans.use: To fix her house

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Chhoeut's Group

texts.en: Chhoeut is a diligent local farmer from Srey Snom district of Siem Reap Province. She is 50 years old and also a mother of two children. She manages four hectare of farmland for growing rice in order to overcome the family’s hardship. The current business that she has been with for 10 years has helped her to earn up to 10,000 KHR per day. Now, she is in a second cycle. Her past loan has been fully repaid and has helped her to sustain her living progressively. Now, she is in a group of three to apply for a new loan. As a group leader, she is going to spend her loan portion to dig a well to raise fish. She hopes to raise more fish and sell them at a high price so that she can double her income gradually.

loans.use: To dig a well to raise fish.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Sarab's Group

texts.en: Sarab is 40 years old and a married mother blessed with seven children. To deal with cost of daily living, she does rice farming on a hectare of farmland, which she has engaged in for 5 years and is able to earn up to 10,000 KHR per day. This is the second cycle for Sarab with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  Her past loan has helped her gradually to uplift her living condition. Now, she is in a group of two to apply for a new loan. For her as a group leader, she is going to spend her loan portion to buy pig feed for raising pigs. She hopes to double her income gradually and keep up a good progress of her living standards.

loans.use: To buy pig feed for raising pigs.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Byambajav

texts.en:
Mr. Byambajav, 36 years old, lives with his wife and four children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house which was built in 2012. Before living in the house they lived in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on another person’s land. He has been rendering transportation service for ten years. 

From 2003 to 2011, he was rendering transportation services using his own microvan within the districts of Ulaanbaatar. Since 2011, he changed his service routine and began to go for transportation between Ulaanbaatar and Zavkhan, the western province of Mongolia, in order to generate more income as all of his children are growing and their expenses are increasing. 

He is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase furniture for the coming Mongolian traditional holiday as known as White moon. As a result, the whole family can greet the most popular Mongolian holiday with joy and happiness. It is certain, the new furniture will add to the attractiveness of their house greatly.

loans.use: to purchase furniture.

loans.name: Pao

texts.en:
Pao is 34 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening up animal for more than ten years, earning approximately $1 daily. Her husband (who is joining her in the picture) runs the business of purchasing motorbike to resale. He makes an income of $10 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Pao is requesting a loan of $1000 for her husband to purchase motorbikes to resell. This money will help him generate more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand the business and help her children earn bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase motorbike to resale

loans.name: Poch

texts.en:
Poch, 57, is from a rural village located in the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province. She is widowed, with one daughter who is still dependent on her and works as a garment worker in the local area to help support the family. 

Poch has struggled to earn a living through farming, which she has been doing for ten years. The current business earns her family about US$10 per day; she manages to save about US$5 each day after daily expenses. 

This is the first microloan for Poch with VisionFund. Poch will use her loan to buy a motorbike. This loan will enable her to have a proper motor for commuting her family. She hopes to make a better life and to improve the family’s living condition.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her daughter to commute to work.

loans.name: Salat's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural area located in the Srey Snom district where rice farming is a common way to earn a living, Salat is aged 34 and is married. To support the family, she has struggled to feed her four children by farming rice on 1.5-hectares of farmland. All of her children are dependents and still in school. Having been in the business for five years, the current business earns her approximately 10,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
Salat’s group consists of three members who have been with VisionFund for six cycles. Salat successfully paid back the past loans which have helped her to better support her children’s education. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy piglets to raise to earn additional income for the family. Salat hopes to fatten her pigs so as to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Dambae district, Cheng is aged 44 and is married with four children, two of whom are still in school. The main sources of income for the family come from rice farming and planting cassava. To better support her family, her husband complements the income by planting rubber trees. They have been in this business for twenty years. The current business earns her about 17US$ per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Cheang has been with VisionFund for five cycles and completely paid back the past loans which have helped her better support her family with enough foods and allowed her to build a new house to live in. Now she is requesting a loan. With this loan, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to increase further her crop yield so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lay's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Tbaung Khmum district, Lay is 37 years old and married. She has two children, both of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She is a rice farmer; her husband is a construction worker. Having been in this business for several years, she can currently earn about 10,000KHR per day.

Lay’s group consists of two members who live in the same village. She is a first-cycle client with VisionFund. 

She is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

She hopes to grow her rice healthfully and timely to sell it profitably.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district, Ny is 37 years old and has three children. She has been working as a rice farmer for several years and complements her income by raising pigs. She earns about $9 a day from the current business and saves about $4 a day.

Ny is requesting her first loan from VisionsFund, which she will use to buy fertilizers for her farmland and piglets for raising.  She hopes this loan will enable her to earn additional income to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Som's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the Sa Ang district where crop farming is a common way to make a living, Som, 43, is a single woman. To earn a living, she has been in farming for 20 years. She is able to earn about 11,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 4,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 

Som has been with VisionFund for five cycles and completely paid back the past loans which have helped her better support her family. She is now leading her group of three to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yield to better her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Mala's Group

texts.en:
Living a wooden house in the Sa Ang district of Kandal province province, Mala is 25 years old and married with two children, both of whom are dependent on her and still in school. Mala earns a living by working as a garment worker while her husband raises pigs and catches fish to earn additional income for the family. With the current business, he can earn about 15,000KHR per day. 
Mala has been with VisionFund for one cycles and completely paid back the past loan which has helped her better support her children’s education. She is now leading her group of five to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy more piglets and pig feed to nourish them. She hopes this loan will enable her to raise her pigs healthfully and timely so as to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and pig feed to nourish them.

loans.name: Sydney Ximena

texts.es:
Sydney tiene 20 años vive en la zona de Achachicala de la ciudad de La Paz, vive en la casa de su madre, tiene una hija de un año y medio, cuenta con el servicio de desayuno con 3 años de experiencia en su actividad, la cliente tiene experiencia en el manejo de sus recursos. Se provee de los insumos para su venta del mercado Rodríguez.  Atiende el servicio de desayuno en la zona de San Pedro (en la foto se encuentra en su caseta de venta con clientes). Cuenta con clientela segura.
La Sra. Ximena  con el transcurso del tiempo se fue capitalizando para vender, ella es madre soltera educa a su hijo sola desde que nació con el sustento de su propio trabajo, ya que no cuenta con apoyo familiar, y solo tiene el apoyo de su madre. Madruga a las cinco de la mañana para preparar la comida ya que en el lugar de venta atiende  desde las seis y media de la mañana.
El destino del crédito es para compra de mercadería en abarrotes. Requiere del mismo para incrementar sus ingresos y así poder vender platos de comida y tener un poco más de ingresos por las fiestas de fin de año.
texts.en:
Sydney is 20 years old and lives in the Achachicala area of the city of La Paz. She lives in her mother's house and has a daughter who is one and a half years old. She has a breakfast service with 3 years experience in this business activity. She has experience managing her resources. She buys her supplies from the Rodriguez market. She serves breakfast in the area of San Pedro (in the photo she is inside her food stall with customers). She counts on reliable customers.

Sydney Ximena has been capitalizing to sell over time. She is a single mother and educates her child alone since she was born with what she earns from her own job, as she does not have the support of her family, only her mother. She gets up early at five o'clock in the morning to prepare the food, as she needs to be in her workplace serving customers from 6:30 am.

This loan will be used to buy supplies in the grocery store. She needs this in order to increase her income and so be able to sell plates of food and have a little more income for the end of year celebrations.

loans.use: to buy food supplies.

loans.name: Lusmila

texts.es: La Sra. Lusmila vive con su pareja y tienen dos hijos desde hace años, radican en el trópico de Cochabamba, en el municipio de Entre Ríos, desde hace 10 años. La Sra. Lusmila es de la provincia chapare del departamento de Cochabamba, uno de los lugares más pobres de Bolivia, vino de su comunidad de Yapacani como la mayoría de las personas buscando mayor oportunidad de vida, en su comunidad bajo  su ingresos debido a la competencia, difícil de controlar, por lo que decidió ir al trópico, pero con el trascurso del tiempo, con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo se compró su lote urbano, en la que hoy en día trabaja en el sector juegos en red e internet y se dedica a la juegos en red e internet. El crédito que está solicitando es para compra de materiales escolares para tener como una librería,que también  de esta manera podrá mejorar su nivel de vida también su pareja le colabora en sus actividades.
texts.en:
Lusmila lives with her spouse, and they have two children. For ten years, they have lived in the tropical area of Cochabamba in the municipality of Entre Rios. 

Lusmila is from the Chapare province of the Department of Cochabamba, one of the poorest places in Bolivia. Like the majority of people, she came from her community of Yapacani searching for a better opportunity in life. 

In her community, her earnings decreased due to the competition, which is difficult to control. Therefore, she decided to go to the tropical area. After time, with a lot of hard work and effort she purchased some land in the city, where today she works in the entertainment sector with the Internet. 

The loan that she is requesting is to purchase educational materials to have for a bookstore. In this way, she will also be able to improve her standard of living and that of her spouse, who helps her with her activities.

loans.use: to purchase bookstore materials.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
Marcelino  es una persona muy joven soltero,  él vive con sus padres en una casita muy humilde, con  25 años de edad,   desde muy pequeño se dedicó a trabajar en la agricultura donde fue aprendiendo a cultivar diferentes productos como papa, cebolla, maní, frejol, Marcelino no solo se dedica a trabajar sino también a cuidar de su padre, que por la edad sufre de una enfermedad que no le deja trabajar teniendo que reposar cada día en la cama.
